commit_message:
Adding network api xml support

Network API tests with xml formatted request body were missing.
I added code to support this feature.
In the test cases "test_list_subnets" and "test_list_networks",
response code check was also missing.
I also added this check in the code.

commit_message:
Remove redundant _create_instance method from test_compute

The _create_instance method in test_compute.BaseTestCase simply calls
through to _create_fake_instance, so it's redundant. Furthermore, the
docstring was wrong, it said it returned a UUID when it really returned
the instance reference. This patch simply removes _create_instance and
replaces it's usage with _create_fake_instance.

Fixes bug 1206993

Change-Id: I3fc42c94691cd0d046f19cdf2110a95b9a125edd

commit_message:
Fix EC2 API Fault wrapper

Fault wrapper now returns actual EC2 error code instead of HTTP
status code which was ridiculously incorrect behavior.

Fault:__call__ wasn't covered by any unit tests, so I added one.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes
Change-Id: I41f7f0aa09e2925882a0da941f9ea5d4e694e65c

commit_message:
Generic backup_volume and restore_backup functions

Add implementation for backup_volume and restore_backup to the
VolumeDriver class, which uses brick for attach and detach.
Add default NotImplmeneted implmentation for non block drivers:
remotefs, coraid, gpfs, scality, sheepdog and sm.

Change-Id: I291390a58608b14f0deea703fc5cec3e34b965cd

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-08-20 03:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Fixes auto confirm invalid error

In the confirm_resize method at the compute API level, the 'metadata' attribute
is used to notify the instance usage and the 'system_metadata' attribute is
needed to get the old/new instance type values and the old vm_state, but the
auto confirm periodic task doesn't get the instance object with these two
attributes. This results in 'KeyError' exception being raised when the auto
confirm periodic task runs.
This commit sets expected_attrs to get 'metadata' and 'system_metadata' when
retrieving the instance object in the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes compute manager
method.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

Fixes bug 1202975

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes auto confirm invalid error

In the confirm_resize method at the compute API level, the 'metadata' attribute
is used to notify the instance usage and the 'system_metadata' attribute is
needed to get the old/new instance type values and the old vm_state, but the
auto confirm periodic task doesn't get the instance object with these two
attributes. This results in 'KeyError' exception being raised when the auto
confirm periodic task runs.
This commit sets expected_attrs to get 'metadata' and 'system_metadata' when
retrieving the instance object in the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes compute manager
method.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

Fixes bug 1202975

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f

commit_message:
redundant conditions in paginate-query

For a list call on images, when a sort_key is applied, the query
generated has redundant values for 'created_at' condition. This happens
when the sort_key list has duplicate values.

Fixes Bug #1212994

Change-Id: Icd62c2886d9ab608418ba9b4dc25cd06a4146992

commit_message:
Add support for swap_volume

Add client support for swap_volume, which allows swapping a volume
currently attached to an instance with a different volume which is not
attached. The contents of the old volume will be copied onto the new
volume. This was added in nova commit
8f51b120b430c7c21399256f37e1d8f75d030484.

Change-Id: I98323d594617c1c435e403d9f3ddc4ff4fa74da6

subject: Support EC2 API wildcards for DescribeTags filters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6624, 'name': 'Stephen Gran', 'email': 'sgran@debian.org', 'username': 'sgran'}, {'_account_id': 6661, 'name': 'Burt Holzman', 'email': 'holzman@gmail.com', 'username': 'burt'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-26 14:34:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/ec2/test_api.py', 'nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/ec2utils.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Support EC2 API wildcards for DescribeTags filters

The EC2 API supports glob-style wildcards in filters.

From http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html:

"You can use wildcards in a filter value. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and
a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a
backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\\ searches for the literal
string *amazon?\."

This patch converts the glob-style regex to a python regex and uses re.match to do the rest. The
approach to the conversion was taken from the python fnmatch library.

Fixes bug #1205099

Change-Id: Ie9cac182faabf50fc0d40480db39a46a7e97fbec
'}]
commit_message:
Support EC2 API wildcards for DescribeTags filters

The EC2 API supports glob-style wildcards in filters.

From http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html:

"You can use wildcards in a filter value. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and
a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a
backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\\ searches for the literal
string *amazon?\."

This patch converts the glob-style regex to a python regex and uses re.match to do the rest. The
approach to the conversion was taken from the python fnmatch library.

Fixes bug #1205099

Change-Id: Ie9cac182faabf50fc0d40480db39a46a7e97fbec

subject: clean temp dir in /tmp
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-15 16:17:28.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_bulk.py'], 'message': "clean temp dir in /tmp

In unit tests, many test class use tempfile.mkdtemp in SetUp and
shutil.rmtree in tearDown.

A common wrong case is putting test data in `testdir = os.join(mkdtemp() +
'some_class')` and `rmmtree(testdir)`. As a result, /tmp/xxx/some_class
was deleted, but /tmp/xxx is still leaved in system. So a proper fix is
`rmtree(os.path.dirname(testdir), ignore_errors=1)`

fixes bug #1212583

Change-Id: Iafbe3e11f16b51bdf49abce9e68eb01f25bc5df2
"}]
commit_message:
clean temp dir in /tmp

In unit tests, many test class use tempfile.mkdtemp in SetUp and
shutil.rmtree in tearDown.

A common wrong case is putting test data in `testdir = os.join(mkdtemp() +
'some_class')` and `rmmtree(testdir)`. As a result, /tmp/xxx/some_class
was deleted, but /tmp/xxx is still leaved in system. So a proper fix is
`rmtree(os.path.dirname(testdir), ignore_errors=1)`

fixes bug #1212583

Change-Id: Iafbe3e11f16b51bdf49abce9e68eb01f25bc5df2

subject: Don't use OpenDNS as the default resolvers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-21 18:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/dhcp_agent_spec.rb'], 'message': "Don't use OpenDNS as the default resolvers

OpenDNS returns self referencing records instead of pure
NXDOMAIN records:

root@kevin-test-1:~# host kevin-test
kevin-test has address 67.215.65.132
Host kevin-test not found: 3(NXDOMAIN)

NetRange:       67.215.64.0 - 67.215.95.255
CIDR:           67.215.64.0/19
OriginAS:       AS36692
NetName:        OPENDNS-NET-3

Clearly this is not preferable when the server is being
used as an upstream resolver for internal DNS which may
send incorrectly configured applications running in VMs
to the wrong place

Change-Id: I098bb57e9e71fc3db5b3e4b3d42d9a3e1d966a04
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use OpenDNS as the default resolvers

OpenDNS returns self referencing records instead of pure
NXDOMAIN records:

root@kevin-test-1:~# host kevin-test
kevin-test has address 67.215.65.132
Host kevin-test not found: 3(NXDOMAIN)

NetRange:       67.215.64.0 - 67.215.95.255
CIDR:           67.215.64.0/19
OriginAS:       AS36692
NetName:        OPENDNS-NET-3

Clearly this is not preferable when the server is being
used as an upstream resolver for internal DNS which may
send incorrectly configured applications running in VMs
to the wrong place

Change-Id: I098bb57e9e71fc3db5b3e4b3d42d9a3e1d966a04

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-16 00:18:50.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/tests/unit/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': 'Adds default route to DHCP namespace for upstream name resolution.

Any time the DHCP server is updated this code will maintain a default
route in the DHCP namespace using the gateway_ip attribute of the
first DHCP-enabled IPV4 subnet in the list of subnets where gateway_ip
is not None.  This strategy uses the same gateway ip that the DHCP

	quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py

commit_message:
Adds default route to DHCP namespace for upstream name resolution.

Any time the DHCP server is updated this code will maintain a default
route in the DHCP namespace using the gateway_ip attribute of the
first DHCP-enabled IPV4 subnet in the list of subnets where gateway_ip
is not None.  This strategy uses the same gateway ip that the DHCP
server hands to the VMs on the network.

Fixes: Bug #1181378

Conflicts:

	quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I0807550a848e1b610c7775d215643ad9c83629ed
(cherry picked from commit 5dd0cf15463e181b92c8809c2dcc7603bb156a0e)

subject: Port volumes swap to the new API-v3
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-08-20 14:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/extended_volumes.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_extended_volumes.py', 'etc/nova/policy.json', 'nova/tests/fake_policy.py'], 'message': "Port volumes swap to the new API-v3

This ports the additions in the API from the change-Id
Iaace71f46acd33cf1531d953d569c0b6d0bbe680.
Since volumes API wasn't selected to port some changes were made to make volumes
swap fit into extended_volumes, the request will now be done like:
    PUT v3/servers/<server_uuid>/action
and the request body will be something like:

{ 'swap_volume_attachment': {
                            'new_volume_id': <volume_id>,
                            'old_volume_id': <another_volume_id,
                          }
}

Also adds expected_errors decorator and more unittests

Related to blueprint volume-swap
Related to blueprint nova-api-v3

Change-Id: Ia3a9efd68ec52a7bfe8cbe0a6518dd91527f8903
"}]
commit_message:
Port volumes swap to the new API-v3

This ports the additions in the API from the change-Id
Iaace71f46acd33cf1531d953d569c0b6d0bbe680.
Since volumes API wasn't selected to port some changes were made to make volumes
swap fit into extended_volumes, the request will now be done like:
    PUT v3/servers/<server_uuid>/action
and the request body will be something like:

{ 'swap_volume_attachment': {
                            'new_volume_id': <volume_id>,
                            'old_volume_id': <another_volume_id,
                          }
}

Also adds expected_errors decorator and more unittests

Related to blueprint volume-swap
Related to blueprint nova-api-v3

Change-Id: Ia3a9efd68ec52a7bfe8cbe0a6518dd91527f8903

commit_message:
make neutron-ns-metadata-proxy configurable

Introduced a new configuration parameter for DHCP and L3 agent
to be able to set the path of the metadata socket to be used
by neutron-ns-metadata-proxy when started inside the DHCP or L3
agent. Also moved the configuration parameter of the
neutron-ns-metadata-proxy to the CLI parameters.

fixes bug #1202628

Change-Id: I3b1aa72b4e06c00f7fed152f0ee03d52b6bbc279

commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

commit_message:
Add per-form validators to services markup.

This allows to implement joint validator for hostname template and number
of instances in all services.

Also:

1) Refactor append_properties function(rename to push_properties
and move to field classes).
2) Change service forms markup so each form has a name.
3) Change yaql-validators syntax to {YAQL: validatorExpression}.

Change-Id: Ia6b32e14213b147881b242710ca130a4dea3cdb2

commit_message:
Add get_instances_availability_zones into nova.az

As discussed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28669/.
create a helper method to get a list of availability zone of
some instances. Also add test for the method.

In db level, aggregate_metadata_get_by_host() and
aggregate_metadata_get_by_hosts() are similar, just using
different criterion of aggregate host. So create a new method
to reuse these code.

part of bp: different-availability-zone-filter

Change-Id: If3dc7d31a7e7114d20057f9e2d6d4b2f926efe8d

commit_message:
H233 regex can not match some print operator

The regex in H233 checking can not cover the following print operator:
print ('*' * 40) + ' REQUEST ENVIRON'

Change the regex to cover it.
update the sample in doc

Fixes Bug #1211199

Change-Id: I1e0ecb08df98aa1644f8e110a214cbac6fdfbe70

subject: Impose a configurable size limit on raw JSON body
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-21 01:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/common/wsgi.py', 'heat/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Impose a configurable size limit on raw JSON body

Currently WSGI will accept very large templates. The raw size is
not much of a concern at 4MB, but parsing that template can create a
recursive memory consumption which leads to the API server eating up
extreme amounts of memory, sometimes leading to MemoryError. Assuming
the template could pass through the API to the engine, this would also
put a heavy burden on an engine and/or the RPC system as well.

Limiting the JSON portion of the body should prevent any large templates
from entering the system.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: Id582a560cc37886648eba612346c4ccaf785f4e0
'}]
commit_message:
Impose a configurable size limit on raw JSON body

Currently WSGI will accept very large templates. The raw size is
not much of a concern at 4MB, but parsing that template can create a
recursive memory consumption which leads to the API server eating up
extreme amounts of memory, sometimes leading to MemoryError. Assuming
the template could pass through the API to the engine, this would also
put a heavy burden on an engine and/or the RPC system as well.

Limiting the JSON portion of the body should prevent any large templates
from entering the system.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: Id582a560cc37886648eba612346c4ccaf785f4e0

commit_message:
Boot from image destination - volume

Added class DriverImageBlockDevice that implements
creating volume from image on booting VM
from image if destination_type is volume.

Adding converting to legacy if source is image and
destination is a volume.

Change-Id: I8b8a7a2e40c083c18c4808b6b340360138086c1f
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2013-08-19 16:45:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': "Virt driver flag for different BDM formats

This patch introduces a new virt driver property
'need_legacy_block_device_info' that will tell the compute manager if
driver needs to be passed legacy block_device_info.

This patch also refactors the compute manager methods that would pass
the block device info to driver methods - to do so according to the
property of the driver. This is done by moving all the code into a single
private method _get_instance_volume_block_device_info. This method existed
before but now uses the new DriverBlockDevice classes for it's
functionality.

As it is sometimes necessary to refresh the connection info for volume
based DriverBlockDevice objects (a private manager method
_refresh_block_device_connection_info was used for this), this patch
also factors this code to a method on the DriverVolumeBlockDeviceClass,
and is now completely used like that when needed, and removes the said
method.

Finally - this patch removes a _get_block_device_info method from the
compute API class. This remained from early pre-conductor attempts to
remove DB access from the compute service, and is irrelevant now that
conductor is used. This is needed so that the source  of block device
data is always conductor and the version of data is always
known.

After this patch - it will be possible to implement changes in drivers
that will allow them to utilise the new block device data format.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: If961329061e5413824d891eada645dd8dd9cb6dd
"}]
commit_message:
Virt driver flag for different BDM formats

This patch introduces a new virt driver property
'need_legacy_block_device_info' that will tell the compute manager if
driver needs to be passed legacy block_device_info.

This patch also refactors the compute manager methods that would pass
the block device info to driver methods - to do so according to the
property of the driver. This is done by moving all the code into a single
private method _get_instance_volume_block_device_info. This method existed
before but now uses the new DriverBlockDevice classes for it's
functionality.

As it is sometimes necessary to refresh the connection info for volume
based DriverBlockDevice objects (a private manager method
_refresh_block_device_connection_info was used for this), this patch
also factors this code to a method on the DriverVolumeBlockDeviceClass,
and is now completely used like that when needed, and removes the said
method.

Finally - this patch removes a _get_block_device_info method from the
compute API class. This remained from early pre-conductor attempts to
remove DB access from the compute service, and is irrelevant now that
conductor is used. This is needed so that the source  of block device
data is always conductor and the version of data is always
known.

After this patch - it will be possible to implement changes in drivers
that will allow them to utilise the new block device data format.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: If961329061e5413824d891eada645dd8dd9cb6dd

commit_message:
Add accept_transfer to solidfire driver

The SolidFire cluster is tenant aware and as such
needs to change account association on volume transfer.

We use the project_id to build this account, so read that
in here and create a new account if necessary and re-assign
the existing volume to the new tenant account.

Change-Id: I29879714c2d32a982918cd1305c8eb00718795fd

commit_message:
Added need info to accept_transfer

Drivers that implement accept_transfer will need
things like the new user_id and project_id.  We were
not including this in the original add, in order for
drivers that are tenant aware this information will be
necessary.

Also the get_volume call in the transfer was using
the new user context, so the volume would never be
found.  We fix this here by providing an elevated
context to the get_volume call when accepting the
transfer.

Change-Id: I7b60c19950f85c4309a97bb842ff238bcf8e746a
Fixes: bug 1213275

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from cinder.utils

These methods were left over from the split from Nova and are unused still.

Remove methods:
	is_valid_ipv4()
	make_dev_path()
	convert_to_list_dict()
	partition_dict()
	subset_dict()

commit_message:
adds lazy app loading to the uwsgi inis.

This change is to resolve the aggressive forking that uwsgi does which
causes it to only have shared sessions across processes in the p11 plugin
and shared db handles as well

Change-Id: I766e50457474844e518c4be6e7dbdd60779064d7

commit_message:
Better indentation for Network Guide chapter "under the hood"

Bug #1211658 reports that the reader was confused that we have
several times "Scenario 1". This is a result of a flat structure, I
grouped the chapter now with better sections and subsections.

Patchset 3: Add dbhtml stop-chunking - thanks Anne for the suggestion.

Patchset 4: Takes in editorial suggestions from Diane (thanks!)

Change-Id: I37d5500b818ad0eed6a4f6fe29317e8dd4134021
Closes-Bug: #1211658

Closes-Bug: #1212772

ML2 doesn't support ext-gw-mode, resulting in L3 agents not
setting-up NAT rules in neutron routers (currently, l3 agents
will assume enable_snat=false if plugin doesn't provide this
parameter as described in bug 1212868)

This patchset adds the support of ext-gw-mode to ML2 plugin.

In order to support ext-gw-mode alembic migration (as well as
other potential migrations on plugin dbs), folsom_initial

plugin startup by sqlalchemy), resulting in migration failures.

Change-Id: I95ec18e0a4f0e5b661f3a5d679c434f18f100fa6
"}]
commit_message:
Add ext-gw-mode support to ML2

Closes-Bug: #1212772

ML2 doesn't support ext-gw-mode, resulting in L3 agents not
setting-up NAT rules in neutron routers (currently, l3 agents
will assume enable_snat=false if plugin doesn't provide this
parameter as described in bug 1212868)

This patchset adds the support of ext-gw-mode to ML2 plugin.

In order to support ext-gw-mode alembic migration (as well as
other potential migrations on plugin dbs), folsom_initial
migration script is fixed to include ML2 plugin. Otherwise
databases won't be set-up during migration script (but at
plugin startup by sqlalchemy), resulting in migration failures.

Change-Id: I95ec18e0a4f0e5b661f3a5d679c434f18f100fa6

commit_message:
Fix Fibre Channel attach for single WWN

The code allowed for only a string of the WWN or a list of them.
Unfortunately unicode is also returned, for which the attach fails.
This patch allows for unicode as well.

Change-Id: I4d2809b41b24b2240e447a5c09f14e6438304cd6
Fixes: bug 1214413

Update Brick to use executor

modify existing modules in Brick
to make use of the Executor object,
so we don't replicated the same
set_execute() method everywhere.

commit_message:
docs: Add 'description' field to domains

When the 'description' field got added for domains and records,
only the documentation for records was updated.

Also, fix minor domain schema error - the description for the
"created_at" and "updated_at" fields in domain.json is incorrect
in the v1 code base.

Change-Id: Id50ed109be81723da8e46e23f792173f435e0e3e
Fixes: bug#1213273

subject: Limit requests version
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7126, 'name': 'Vadim Rovachev', 'email': 'vrovachev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vrovachev'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7555, 'name': 'Matthew Farrellee', 'email': 'matt@redhat.com', 'username': 'farrellee'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-08-21 12:02:30.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Limit requests version

Add <1.2.3 constraint to the requests version to avoid problems with old
versions of python clients. This constraint could be removed when all
clients will be released w/o such constraint and os/reqs will be updated
to support at least such versions of clients.

Change-Id: I3018357a6ac3f1cc7809bd091ec84aa11b83bf0c
'}]
commit_message:
Limit requests version

Add <1.2.3 constraint to the requests version to avoid problems with old
versions of python clients. This constraint could be removed when all
clients will be released w/o such constraint and os/reqs will be updated
to support at least such versions of clients.

Change-Id: I3018357a6ac3f1cc7809bd091ec84aa11b83bf0c

commit_message:
Made Ambari RPM location configurable

The Ambari RPM location is now an ambari configuration property in
the blueprint.  This will support debug/issue resolution scenarios
as well as the export of this information.

Fixes:  bug #1208966

Change-Id: Ie0bfbd39d687c8c26d654b7fcfb369f764d48ef2
(cherry picked from commit f9a7b209083734a37ca8a6c844c785bf95c46772)

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-08-20 22:56:06.000000000', 'files': ['pycadf/host.py', 'pycadf/resource.py', 'pycadf/audit/__init__.py', 'pycadf/endpoint.py', 'pycadf/tests/audit/test_api.py', 'pycadf/event.py', 'pycadf/tests/test_cadf_spec.py', 'pycadf/audit/api.py', 'pycadf/credential.py', 'pycadf/reporterstep.py'], 'message': 'update cadf spec to support new data model

- add Credential type and move token into it
- add Host type and move client_addr, agent into it
- add Endpoint type and move adminUrl, privateUrl into it
- add credential, host, addresses as optional attr of Resource
- add observer attr to event

Change-Id: I663eaf0b2f239300e035f084b8574e615c40a182
Fixes: Bug #1214097
'}]
commit_message:
update cadf spec to support new data model

- add Credential type and move token into it
- add Host type and move client_addr, agent into it
- add Endpoint type and move adminUrl, privateUrl into it
- add credential, host, addresses as optional attr of Resource
- add observer attr to event

Change-Id: I663eaf0b2f239300e035f084b8574e615c40a182
Fixes: Bug #1214097

subject: Add dhcp_domain option to dhcp_agent.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-21 14:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/dhcp_agent_spec.rb', 'templates/default/dhcp_agent.ini.erb'], 'message': 'Add dhcp_domain option to dhcp_agent.ini

This will allow you to set the domain dnsmasq hands out
to instances.
From: http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/dhcp_agent_ini.html
dhcp_domain=openstacklocal  (StrOpt) Domain to use for building the host names.

Defaults to "openstacklocal"

Change-Id: Id963b7a6eeb7d57a5a0797d4e1e2981b8fd9e7a1
'}]
commit_message:
Add dhcp_domain option to dhcp_agent.ini

This will allow you to set the domain dnsmasq hands out
to instances.
From: http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/dhcp_agent_ini.html
dhcp_domain=openstacklocal  (StrOpt) Domain to use for building the host names.

Defaults to "openstacklocal"

Change-Id: Id963b7a6eeb7d57a5a0797d4e1e2981b8fd9e7a1

subject: PowerDNS - Ensure SPF records are quoted correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-12 11:22:32.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_utils.py', 'designate/backend/impl_powerdns/__init__.py', 'designate/utils.py'], 'message': 'PowerDNS - Ensure SPF records are quoted correctly

PowerDNS requires SPF records to be quoted, unlike TXT records which
do not require the quotes.

Change-Id: I3aede09462fdf98dd9dd235e87127afb326f8711
'}]
commit_message:
PowerDNS - Ensure SPF records are quoted correctly

PowerDNS requires SPF records to be quoted, unlike TXT records which
do not require the quotes.

Change-Id: I3aede09462fdf98dd9dd235e87127afb326f8711

subject: Clear out service disabled reason on enable for V3 API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-16 03:29:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/services.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_services.py'], 'message': "Clear out service disabled reason on enable for V3 API

When a service gets re-enabled, clear out the 'disabled_reason' column.
Corresponding fix for the V3 API which was commited for the V2 api
in commit 16b4efdb0d488478c6f03218931bac4c42a278e3

Fixes bug 1212217

Change-Id: I3a5cc716f6c4929abaddf457b06f70f561789f38
"}]
commit_message:
Clear out service disabled reason on enable for V3 API

When a service gets re-enabled, clear out the 'disabled_reason' column.

in commit 16b4efdb0d488478c6f03218931bac4c42a278e3

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-08-14 22:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'swift/__init__.py', 'setup.py', 'setup.cfg', 'test/unit/common/test_init.py'], 'message': 'Migrate to pbr for build

pbr is the libification of what was openstack.common.setup. If provides
the build information in a delcarative form, instead of as executable python
code, which works around the chicken and egg problem of needing setup
libraries present to run setup, but needing to run setup to tell if you
need setup libraries.

One of the features that comes along with this is versioning based on
git tags. If the current revision is a signed git tag, then that is the
version of the package. If it is not, the version is equal to the most
recent git tag, plus a commit count, plus a git sha (similar to git
describe, but scrubbed for python version rules compliance)

pbr updates are also part of the upcoming automation around ensuring
global requirements stay in sync.

Closes-Bug: #1179007
Change-Id: Ia473960be7e8aa44f09d48cea72ed3c8845f82fa
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate to pbr for build

pbr is the libification of what was openstack.common.setup. If provides
the build information in a delcarative form, instead of as executable python
code, which works around the chicken and egg problem of needing setup
libraries present to run setup, but needing to run setup to tell if you
need setup libraries.

One of the features that comes along with this is versioning based on
git tags. If the current revision is a signed git tag, then that is the
version of the package. If it is not, the version is equal to the most
recent git tag, plus a commit count, plus a git sha (similar to git
describe, but scrubbed for python version rules compliance)

pbr updates are also part of the upcoming automation around ensuring
global requirements stay in sync.

Closes-Bug: #1179007
Change-Id: Ia473960be7e8aa44f09d48cea72ed3c8845f82fa

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6623, 'name': 'Roman Prykhodchenko', 'email': 'me@romcheg.me', 'username': 'prykhodchenko'}, {'_account_id': 7534, 'name': 'Yulia Portnova', 'email': 'yportnova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yportnova'}, {'_account_id': 7808, 'name': 'Xavier Queralt', 'email': 'xqueralt@gmail.com', 'username': 'xqueralt'}, {'_account_id': 8291, 'name': 'Valerii Zhelezniakov', 'email': 'vzhelezniakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vzhelezniakov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2013-08-19 16:45:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'Refactor how BDMs are handled when booting

This patch refactors how block devices are handled when booting VMs.
Also it introduces new block device mapping format in the run_instance
manager method of the compute service.

The refactoring is done by creating a simple hierarchy of
DriverBlockDevice classes that are meant to:

1) Provide a common place to keep information about the data that is
kept for each block device type

2) Encapsulate the logic of "attaching" the device from the compute
service point of view (driver will still need to do the actual work).

Currently we have special subclasses for ephemeral, swap, volume and
snapshot devices.

These classes also make it possible to easily provide
the drivers that will require old block device mapping format with it by
overriding the legacy() method.

Another advantage that this refactoring brings is that adding additional
block device types, like Image block devices (coming soon in a subsequent
patch) that can have destination type of either a hypervisor image or a
volume will be just a matter of extending the base class and redefining
attach to do the work of creating the volume if needed.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor how BDMs are handled when booting

This patch refactors how block devices are handled when booting VMs.
Also it introduces new block device mapping format in the run_instance
manager method of the compute service.

The refactoring is done by creating a simple hierarchy of
DriverBlockDevice classes that are meant to:

1) Provide a common place to keep information about the data that is
kept for each block device type

2) Encapsulate the logic of "attaching" the device from the compute
service point of view (driver will still need to do the actual work).

Currently we have special subclasses for ephemeral, swap, volume and
snapshot devices.

These classes also make it possible to easily provide
the drivers that will require old block device mapping format with it by
overriding the legacy() method.

Another advantage that this refactoring brings is that adding additional
block device types, like Image block devices (coming soon in a subsequent
patch) that can have destination type of either a hypervisor image or a
volume will be just a matter of extending the base class and redefining
attach to do the work of creating the volume if needed.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea

subject: Fix isEnabledFor for compatibility with logging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-20 13:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Fix isEnabledFor for compatibility with logging

After refactoring Keystone to use the unified logging implementation
from Oslo-incubator there were some issues using isEnabledFor with the
ContextAdapter provided in keystone/openstack/common/log.py. This
removes those calls and adds a check in keystone/common/wsgi.py to
handle the case where Keystone is running Python 2.6, in which
ContextAdapter doesn't have 'isEnabledFor'.

fixes bug 1213284

Change-Id: I8c64b12dcd9d955c96dc5a48348555ff37b15116
"}]
commit_message:
Fix isEnabledFor for compatibility with logging

After refactoring Keystone to use the unified logging implementation
from Oslo-incubator there were some issues using isEnabledFor with the
ContextAdapter provided in keystone/openstack/common/log.py. This
removes those calls and adds a check in keystone/common/wsgi.py to
handle the case where Keystone is running Python 2.6, in which
ContextAdapter doesn't have 'isEnabledFor'.

fixes bug 1213284

Change-Id: I8c64b12dcd9d955c96dc5a48348555ff37b15116

lead to a misunderstanding, so rename them.

subject: Enhance delayed message translation when _ is imported
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-20 18:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/service.py'], 'message': "Enhance delayed message translation when _ is imported

Delayed message translation currently doesn't work for
messages written from files that import the _ function
directly.  For example:

from ceilometer.openstack.common.gettextutils import _

This change uses new support added to oslo that enables
lazy text translation in files where _ is imported
directly.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ib2189836c6bbeb7e242a77415424fa77af5366f5
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance delayed message translation when _ is imported

Delayed message translation currently doesn't work for
messages written from files that import the _ function
directly.  For example:

from ceilometer.openstack.common.gettextutils import _

This change uses new support added to oslo that enables
lazy text translation in files where _ is imported
directly.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ib2189836c6bbeb7e242a77415424fa77af5366f5

subject: Add a Notifier.prepare() method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-21 06:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/notify/notifier.py', 'tests/test_notifier.py'], 'message': "Add a Notifier.prepare() method

Nova sends notifications with a bunch of different publisher_ids, so we
instantiate quite a lot of Notifier objects. Loading the noification
drivers for each of these is a substantial amount of overhead.

One obvious answer would be to make publisher_id an argument to the
error(), info(), etc. methods, but I think it's nice to encapsulate the
publisher_id in a notifier instance.

Instead, add a prepare() method which mirrors the approach in RPCClient.
You use this method to create a specialized notifier instance with a new
publisher_id.

Change-Id: Ia45fda3164086bb7a9ef6dee0587f726ab8b1a97
"}]
commit_message:
Add a Notifier.prepare() method

Nova sends notifications with a bunch of different publisher_ids, so we
instantiate quite a lot of Notifier objects. Loading the noification
drivers for each of these is a substantial amount of overhead.

One obvious answer would be to make publisher_id an argument to the
error(), info(), etc. methods, but I think it's nice to encapsulate the
publisher_id in a notifier instance.

Instead, add a prepare() method which mirrors the approach in RPCClient.
You use this method to create a specialized notifier instance with a new
publisher_id.

Change-Id: Ia45fda3164086bb7a9ef6dee0587f726ab8b1a97

commit_message:
Check is_public of flavor when creating a instance

If creating a flavor with is_public "false", the flavor should be
accessible by admin or user who is granted to access.
The commit I5b37fa0bb19683fe1642fd81222547d4a317054e has fixed the
"list flavors" and "get flavor details" API.
This patch fixes "create an instance" API.

Fixes bug #1212179

Change-Id: I3bdd9485d31cec32b6fc83b6eed4ee46fd5fe91f

subject: Search filters for get_all_system_metadata should use lists
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-20 18:18:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py'], 'message': "Search filters for get_all_system_metadata should use lists

The search filter should have the form:
[{'foo'}: ['bar'], {'baz'}: ['quux']]

The underlying code accidentally and unfortunately allows filters that look like
[{'foo'}: 'bar', {'baz'}: 'quux'], but that is not guaranteed to work in the future.

Change-Id: Ic28612c8c843194e2f4f6918166177813fd5dee3
"}]
commit_message:
Search filters for get_all_system_metadata should use lists

The search filter should have the form:
[{'foo'}: ['bar'], {'baz'}: ['quux']]

The underlying code accidentally and unfortunately allows filters that look like
[{'foo'}: 'bar', {'baz'}: 'quux'], but that is not guaranteed to work in the future.

Change-Id: Ic28612c8c843194e2f4f6918166177813fd5dee3

subject: GPFS support for various volume attributes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-09 20:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters', 'cinder/volume/drivers/gpfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_gpfs.py'], 'message': 'GPFS support for various volume attributes

Specify the following attributes when creating a new volume:

* The storage pool on which the volume is placed
* Number of block-level replicas
* Whether the physical blocks should be allocated locally on the node issuing
  the IO or striped across the cluster
* Whether writes to the volume should use direct IO
* Number of file system blocks to be laid out sequentially on disk to behave
  like a single large block
* Local storage attached to specific node(s) where the replicas of the
  volume should be allocated

Change-Id: I77bb7de32bbde5a125f8c6f9a727b538ea99bc18
Implements: blueprint gpfs-volume-attributes
'}]
commit_message:
GPFS support for various volume attributes

Specify the following attributes when creating a new volume:

* The storage pool on which the volume is placed
* Number of block-level replicas
* Whether the physical blocks should be allocated locally on the node issuing
  the IO or striped across the cluster
* Whether writes to the volume should use direct IO
* Number of file system blocks to be laid out sequentially on disk to behave
  like a single large block
* Local storage attached to specific node(s) where the replicas of the
  volume should be allocated

Change-Id: I77bb7de32bbde5a125f8c6f9a727b538ea99bc18
Implements: blueprint gpfs-volume-attributes

commit_message:
Implement assignment of Project Roles to Group

Added Project Groups step in the Project workflow for managing
project-role assignment to Groups.

The feature is only enabled if the application is running KS V3.

Moved the logic for filtering Groups by Domain into keystone.py.

Change-Id: I48b1aba162646a5327f6442a864e2015596a99c6
Implements: blueprint group-role-assignment

commit_message:
Clean-up code issues related to reboot

 - Don't import nova client directly in a panel, client details should
   only live in openstack_dashboard/api
 - "allowed()" now checks if instances is None, which can happen with
   BatchActions
 - Remove unused reboot() method from Server
 - Fix import order for 'logging' module

Fixes: bug #1213853

Change-Id: I56f810c6d451d68cb8326a0fa4f89462f74e9bf7

commit_message:
Change detaching interface to synchronous

Like attaching interface, detaching interface should also be synchronous,
so the failures in nova-compute could return for API callers.

Fixes: bug #1205951

subject: Add a tox env for future-facing flake8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-13 17:53:40.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add a tox env for future-facing flake8

flake8 can run checks on just the patch in question. If we turn this on,
it can let us enforce not breaking things in new patches, even if the
codebase overall can't handle the check.

Change-Id: Ibdebdbd4d50c5ef63b1f779130022c07307578e0
"}]
commit_message:
Add a tox env for future-facing flake8

flake8 can run checks on just the patch in question. If we turn this on,
it can let us enforce not breaking things in new patches, even if the
codebase overall can't handle the check.

Change-Id: Ibdebdbd4d50c5ef63b1f779130022c07307578e0

commit_message:
Move tests into glanceclient.

This makes them consistent with glance, for one, and also consistent
with the majority of OpenStack projects. Additionally, tests/__init__.py
is implying a global tests package, which is not what glanceclient uses.
These tests are specific to glanceclient, not global in scope.

Change-Id: I51d7563fa2879963137afeab0911ec712595def3

commit_message:
Removed need for domain in 3PAR drivers

The 3PAR drivers need to support CPGs that are not part of a
virtual domain on the 3PAR backend. This patch removes the need
for the CPG to be part of a domain and changes a few of the commands
that took the domain as an option.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7e472e19e484e837c9216ea01455a4b8a85b19e5
Fixes: bug #1212328

subject: Always display the Domains panel for Keystone V3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-14 22:07:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/domains/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/domains/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'message': 'Always display the Domains panel for Keystone V3

The Domains panel is only displayed when the user explicitly set
the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT to True and keystone
supports V3.

The change allows the Domain panel to be displayed even if the flag
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT is False. In this case, the
CRUD actions will not be available in the panel.

If the local_settings.py.example is taken as is, Keystone V3 is
assumed to be available. The Domain panel should also be available.

Change-Id: Ifa81c6f106ba98a192a163aeb80f0ff92888d954
Fixes: bug 1211667
'}]
commit_message:
Always display the Domains panel for Keystone V3

The Domains panel is only displayed when the user explicitly set
the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT to True and keystone
supports V3.

The change allows the Domain panel to be displayed even if the flag
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT is False. In this case, the
CRUD actions will not be available in the panel.

If the local_settings.py.example is taken as is, Keystone V3 is
assumed to be available. The Domain panel should also be available.

Change-Id: Ifa81c6f106ba98a192a163aeb80f0ff92888d954
Fixes: bug 1211667

commit_message:
Hide default Floating IPs quotas with Neutron

It is not possible to access the default quotas via an API for
Neutron. Remove the quota in that case for now, as it comes from Nova
and could cause confusion.

Partial-Bug: #1109140

Change-Id: If8df21b4ecbe541ce53790578820e22f36c32260

subject: Enforce flavor access during instance boot
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-20 15:38:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Enforce flavor access during instance boot

The code in the servers API did not pass the context when retrieving
flavor details.  That means it would use an admin context instead,
bypassing all flavor access control checks.

This patch includes the fix, and the corresponding unit test, for both
the v2 and v3 APIs.

Closes-bug: #1212179

Change-Id: I681ae9965e19767df22fa74c3315e4e03a459d3b
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce flavor access during instance boot

The code in the servers API did not pass the context when retrieving
flavor details.  That means it would use an admin context instead,
bypassing all flavor access control checks.

This patch includes the fix, and the corresponding unit test, for both
the v2 and v3 APIs.

Closes-bug: #1212179

Change-Id: I681ae9965e19767df22fa74c3315e4e03a459d3b

commit_message:
Add role based access control (RBAC) to Barbican

Barbican must support RBAC on its various REST methods. This commit adds logic to enforce
RBAC rules defined in a policy.json to the REST resource API methods they need to
protect for unauthorized access. The implementation utilizes the latest oslo policy
module updates to read, parse and enforce RBAC rules.

Change-Id: I94b1709532540947ab3f1c9878c883a1fd167183
Implements: blueprint rbac-add-support

commit_message:
Add a tiny bit more verbosity to validate.py

validate.py did not give any progress ahead of which books are going to
get build which is a bit annoying if you run it locally.

With my patch you see:
$ tools/validate.py

Following files will be validated:
>>> doc/src/docbkx/openstack-network-connectivity-admin/app_demo_routers_with_private_networks.xml

Queuing the following books for building:
  openstack-network-connectivity-admin
Building all books now...
>>> Build of book openstack-network-connectivity-admin succeeded.

Change-Id: Ib5dbe41dea7512ea33fd314ca8842bc5e38cf4ba

subject: Restore support for keystoneclient.client module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-21 00:15:34.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_http.py', 'keystoneclient/client.py'], 'message': "Restore support for keystoneclient.client module

The keystoneclient.client module was renamed to
keystoneclient.httpclient with commit b7c6f604e. The rename
caused applications using keystoneclient.client to not work.

This change restores support for keystoneclient.client. It's
deprecated in favor of keystoneclient.httpclient.

Change-Id: I22e6afe59afa8567f4fc4e742f74146221de3ea4
Resolves-Bug: #1211998
"}]
commit_message:
Restore support for keystoneclient.client module

The keystoneclient.client module was renamed to
keystoneclient.httpclient with commit b7c6f604e. The rename
caused applications using keystoneclient.client to not work.

This change restores support for keystoneclient.client. It's
deprecated in favor of keystoneclient.httpclient.

Change-Id: I22e6afe59afa8567f4fc4e742f74146221de3ea4
Resolves-Bug: #1211998

commit_message:
Add a NullHandler when setting up library logging

I was gunna write a test, but mocking ImportErrors is a PITA, so I decided to
just get my tox py26 working instead.  Tests seem to fail/pass as expected
without/with the inline NullHanlder.

Closes-Bug: 1212861

Change-Id: I20207374a77ee9969ab201c3a57e4caf40c02a61

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-08-04 04:46:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_network_info.py', 'nova/network/model.py', 'nova/virt/interfaces.template'], 'message': 'Support networks without gateway

Launching an instance when using network injection on a network
containing a subnet that has no gateway fails in scheduling with
a KeyError when using a legacy network_info provider and generates
an invalid network file for the others.

The following changes were done:

* The legacy transformer for network_info now always provides
  a gateway/gateway_v6 field, with a value of None if no gateway
  is available (this is similar to the other fields that are empty).
* The interfaces template was modified to include the gateway line
  only if a gateway is provided for the interface.

Fixes: bug #1207878
Change-Id: I887757a6bcba528059ace8831a7d23a31b08c630
'}]
commit_message:
Support networks without gateway

Launching an instance when using network injection on a network
containing a subnet that has no gateway fails in scheduling with
a KeyError when using a legacy network_info provider and generates
an invalid network file for the others.

The following changes were done:

* The legacy transformer for network_info now always provides
  a gateway/gateway_v6 field, with a value of None if no gateway
  is available (this is similar to the other fields that are empty).
* The interfaces template was modified to include the gateway line
  only if a gateway is provided for the interface.

Fixes: bug #1207878
Change-Id: I887757a6bcba528059ace8831a7d23a31b08c630

commit_message:
Document connecting to qemu:///system with virsh.

On redhat based systems, non-root users connect to qemu:///session by
default instead of qemu:///system.  This can by changed by setting an
environment variable.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-07-18 16:37:37.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/cmd/__init__.py', 'glance/api/v2/image_members.py', 'glance/cmd/replicator.py', 'glance/openstack/common/gettextutils.py', 'glance/api/v2/image_tags.py'], 'message': 'Add support for API message localization

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is then
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ia34547d618cfa6ad6458554932db710d63ef369a
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for API message localization

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is then
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Ia34547d618cfa6ad6458554932db710d63ef369a

subject: RPC: Add support for optional message signing
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-08-05 15:31:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/rpc/common.py', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_common.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/__init__.py'], 'message': 'RPC: Add support for optional message signing

Wires in SecureMessage so that signing can be optionally used.
Signing messages is always attempted but failing to create a signed message is
currently not fatal. In case of failure the message is sent unsigned.

Once all services has been converted to support signing, we can start switching
on mandatory signing.

Currently the service name needs to be a global due to the way services are
constructed.

Change-Id: Ie565bbaf61a69a4e526e78e723efecb5e2712877
'}]
commit_message:
RPC: Add support for optional message signing

Wires in SecureMessage so that signing can be optionally used.
Signing messages is always attempted but failing to create a signed message is
currently not fatal. In case of failure the message is sent unsigned.

Once all services has been converted to support signing, we can start switching
on mandatory signing.

Currently the service name needs to be a global due to the way services are
constructed.

Change-Id: Ie565bbaf61a69a4e526e78e723efecb5e2712877

subject: Enable the translation handler to be configured via logging.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-15 17:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py', 'tests/unit/test_log.py'], 'message': "Enable the translation handler to be configured via logging.conf

The patch also ensures the formatter set for the translation handler is
set on the target handler too.

With this patch secondary log will be configurable declaratively in the
logging.conf, for example:

    [handlers]
    keys = secondarylog, translation

    [handler_secondarylog]
    class = handlers.WatchedFileHandlerargs = ('/oslo-localized.log',)
    formatter = context

    [handler_translation]
    class = openstack.common.log.TranslationHandler
    target = secondarylog
    args = ('zh_CN',)

Change-Id: I1c786bb0caedc0ecba23dc351f80a83d829271dd
"}]
commit_message:
Enable the translation handler to be configured via logging.conf

The patch also ensures the formatter set for the translation handler is
set on the target handler too.

With this patch secondary log will be configurable declaratively in the
logging.conf, for example:

    [handlers]
    keys = secondarylog, translation

    [handler_secondarylog]
    class = handlers.WatchedFileHandlerargs = ('/oslo-localized.log',)
    formatter = context

    [handler_translation]
    class = openstack.common.log.TranslationHandler
    target = secondarylog
    args = ('zh_CN',)

Change-Id: I1c786bb0caedc0ecba23dc351f80a83d829271dd

commit_message:
Move LocaleHandler to log module with the rest of the log handlers

This change simply moves the LocaleHandler from gettextutils
to log, and it renames it to TranslationHandler.

Note: No functionality is added or removed in this patch, it is just
a simple refactoring in preparation for future work.

Change-Id: I6bb0c613b3f6e292acc704e010ba77ab63d0e648

Rather than add support for multiple potential live image formats,
just add a 'live' container type. The creator of these images will
have to use properties so that the hypervisor can identify whether

commit_message:
Add support for live images in glance

Rather than add support for multiple potential live image formats,
just add a 'live' container type. The creator of these images will
have to use properties so that the hypervisor can identify whether
or not it can successfully boot the image.

Part of blueprint live-snapshot-vms

Change-Id: I27a5f9837616774dfad1a3baf6c318fc0a300c71

commit_message:
Remove Keystone specific logging module

A unified logging implementation from Oslo-incubator has been carried
over and implemented in Keystone. This is removing the old
keystone/common/logging.py module as it is no longer needed.
Logging in Keystone is now implemented through
keystone/openstack/common/log.py and maintained through Oslo-incubator,
consistent with other logging implementations in OpenStack projects.

blueprint unified-logging-in-keystone

Change-Id: Ib9328a80f60b0b6ec7430d05077aa1a0419e05ac

Since the new format will allow to specify devices that will be created
as images on the hypervisor (if the hypervisor enables it), in order
to prevent a DOS, a new config option 'max_local_block_devices' was
added. This option allows the operator to set a limit on the number of
destination_type='local' block devices a user can specify per VM.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

commit_message:
Make API part of instance boot use new BDM format

This patch makes the API part of the instance boot process rely on the
new BDM format. It adds additional validations that are enabled due to
using the new format.

Since the new format will allow to specify devices that will be created
as images on the hypervisor (if the hypervisor enables it), in order
to prevent a DOS, a new config option 'max_local_block_devices' was
added. This option allows the operator to set a limit on the number of
destination_type='local' block devices a user can specify per VM.

This patch also refactors and simplifies how block devices are handled
during boot, and makes sure that validation errors are caught and
transformed to expected HTTP errors.

Change-Id: I62e0807fcff0a284ff72555d107cac1c9864e46d
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

commit_message:
File movements

In order to rework some of the persistence layer I would
like to move around some of the files first, keeping job
specifics in a jobs folder. Having some of the items which
are root level taskflow items (flow, task) be at the root
of the hiearchy. Also for now until the celery work is
commited move that, since it doesn't make sense in backends
anyway.

Change-Id: If6c149710b40f70d4ec69ee8e523defe8f5e766d

commit_message:
Allow backend & client SQL tests on mysql and pg.

Currently the tables are not created which means that it isn't
possible for these tests to run on anything other than sqlite.

not the same as the id that the token is saved with.

Fix a number of foreign key constraints issues.

revisions:

Requeue the message instead of rejecting it. The AMQP spec
suggests reject()'ing the message to get it back in the queue.
The trick is that there is a parameter "requeue=True" required

Change-Id: I6e820841b87eedb03318124e7d70be8da6970cc2
'}]
commit_message:
requeue instead of reject

Requeue the message instead of rejecting it. The AMQP spec
suggests reject()'ing the message to get it back in the queue.
The trick is that there is a parameter "requeue=True" required
to make this happen. Under kombu, this is done as a separate
command instead of a parameter on reject().

Change-Id: I6e820841b87eedb03318124e7d70be8da6970cc2

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-08-12 14:27:32.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/rpc/amqp.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/common.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_kombu.py'], 'message': "Don't eat callback exceptions and preserve delivery_info

In order to preserve backwards compatibility with existing
callbacks (that may live outside of this library) the
delivery_info and signaling flag is passed in the message
payload.

The implication of catching the exceptions in the callback
is that we have to wait for all the consumers to return.
That is, we lose async on the callbacks. Fortunately, this
is only for the consumers that don't want ack_on_error
behavior.

delivery_info is additional message info included in the
message, but was getting dropped previously. This info is
useful to some consumers (like Ceilometer).

Change-Id: I0a7f590d9bdbc158403b7212619a276c44e945f7
"}]
commit_message:
Don't eat callback exceptions and preserve delivery_info

In order to preserve backwards compatibility with existing
callbacks (that may live outside of this library) the
delivery_info and signaling flag is passed in the message
payload.

The implication of catching the exceptions in the callback
is that we have to wait for all the consumers to return.
That is, we lose async on the callbacks. Fortunately, this
is only for the consumers that don't want ack_on_error
behavior.

delivery_info is additional message info included in the
message, but was getting dropped previously. This info is
useful to some consumers (like Ceilometer).

Change-Id: I0a7f590d9bdbc158403b7212619a276c44e945f7

commit_message:
fix libguestfs mount order when inspecting

variable `mounts` sorted value is
[
    ('/boot', '/dev/vda1'),
    ('/', '/dev/vda2'),
    ('/var', '/dev/vda5'),
    ('/home', '/dev/vda6'),
    ('/home/q', '/dev/vda7')
]
but `/boot` directory is in `/` partition.

Fixes: Bug #1210371
Change-Id: I3d9cd59237bc4fc277415104c9170d2e372a1c25

commit_message:
Merge ch_computescheduler.xml to computescheduler.xml

As a first step in resolving bug 1212862 which states that
/openstack-compute-admin/computescheduler.xml and
/openstack-config/ch_computescheduler.xml should have the same
content, I'll merge all changes done to ch_computescheduler.xml to
computescheduler.xml.

This patch merges the following commits:
    clean-up of 'common' dir in openstack-manuals (remove unused files
and use common naming convention)
    Change-Id: I3e0f03ac42c39a2ed3fed2d530beb61f6b81873c
----
    Adds link to block storage page from config and admin scheduler
pages. Also fixes missed update to admin scheduler page from
bug-1192627,
    Change-Id: Ie33d039a3f668215d32e18edb8b5b3bea71b9aa6
----
    bug 1188522, author sean roberts, removed reference to volume
scheduler in ch_computescheduler.xml

    Change-Id: Ie26b1b8814a169e79ebbdcbde8579e5aa820a823
----

Change-Id: I668a7c54c7e237b3989e44b6745e940d080abbfe
Partial-Bug: #1212862

subject: Remove use_greenlets argument to MongoClient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-20 14:20:20.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': 'Remove use_greenlets argument to MongoClient

use_greenlets causes gevent to be needed. As per the docs:

"If you need to use standard Python threads in the same process as
Gevent and greenlets, run monkey.patch_socket(), rather than
monkey.patch_all(), and create a MongoClient with use_greenlets=True.
The MongoClient will use a special greenlet-aware connection pool."

We do not use threads, so it seems like we're doing extra complexity
without needing it right now. Also, gevent is not python3 or pypy
compatible, so we'd be bringing in a dependency that would make things
harder moving forward.

Change-Id: I7cd2f5958fdef585cd515c8b1b7ae9fb62c26980
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use_greenlets argument to MongoClient

use_greenlets causes gevent to be needed. As per the docs:

"If you need to use standard Python threads in the same process as
Gevent and greenlets, run monkey.patch_socket(), rather than
monkey.patch_all(), and create a MongoClient with use_greenlets=True.
The MongoClient will use a special greenlet-aware connection pool."

We do not use threads, so it seems like we're doing extra complexity
without needing it right now. Also, gevent is not python3 or pypy
compatible, so we'd be bringing in a dependency that would make things
harder moving forward.

Change-Id: I7cd2f5958fdef585cd515c8b1b7ae9fb62c26980

subject: Allow Parameters to set defaults for TemplateResource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 18:53:57.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': 'Allow Parameters to set defaults for TemplateResource

Although it is theoretically possible to infer default values for the
Properties of a TemplateResource from the Parameters of the provider
template, this presents a number of conversion issues that are presently
unhandled.

Instead, pass parameter values only for properties that are supplied.  For
the others, allow the parameter defaults in the template to be used.

Change-Id: I2ba49ffeee06c3a272694c18b3875f843ade1e6c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Parameters to set defaults for TemplateResource

Although it is theoretically possible to infer default values for the
Properties of a TemplateResource from the Parameters of the provider
template, this presents a number of conversion issues that are presently
unhandled.

Instead, pass parameter values only for properties that are supplied.  For
the others, allow the parameter defaults in the template to be used.

Change-Id: I2ba49ffeee06c3a272694c18b3875f843ade1e6c

commit_message:
Demote personalities from core of API v3 as extensions os-personality

This patch move 'personality' from core into extensions.
* demote personality the attribute of server from servers
* add corresponding tests
* move some tests about personality from test_servers to test_personality

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

setup description.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6794, 'name': 'Simon Pasquier', 'email': 'pasquier.simon@gmail.com', 'username': 'simon-pasquier'}, {'_account_id': 7461, 'name': 'Paul Murray', 'email': 'pmurray@hpe.com', 'username': 'ptm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-08 13:20:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/compute/claims.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_claims.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/207_add_rxtx_info_to_compute_node.py'], 'message': "Make bandwidth allocation visible to scheduler

The scheduler and the compute nodes currently keep track of disk,
memory and vcpu resource allocation. This includes reporting available
and allocated resource values, accounting for their consumption in the
scheduler's HostState class and gating acceptance of new instances at
the compute node in the Claims and ResourceTracker classes. It should
be noted that these are used to manage static resource allocation. They
are not dynamic resource utilization metrics.

Network bandwidth is added to this list to allow the scheduler to be
aware of network allocation at the hosts. This will support the ability
to avoid over-committing network resources at a host.

This is part of: blueprint network-bandwidth-entitlement

Change-Id: Ief204b0f96a5bad9e7d07eb7bda6505ca67ad76d
"}]
commit_message:
Make bandwidth allocation visible to scheduler

The scheduler and the compute nodes currently keep track of disk,
memory and vcpu resource allocation. This includes reporting available
and allocated resource values, accounting for their consumption in the
scheduler's HostState class and gating acceptance of new instances at
the compute node in the Claims and ResourceTracker classes. It should
be noted that these are used to manage static resource allocation. They
are not dynamic resource utilization metrics.

Network bandwidth is added to this list to allow the scheduler to be
aware of network allocation at the hosts. This will support the ability
to avoid over-committing network resources at a host.

This is part of: blueprint network-bandwidth-entitlement

Change-Id: Ief204b0f96a5bad9e7d07eb7bda6505ca67ad76d

subject: Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 21:12:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/rpc/impl_fake.py'], 'message': "Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found

If you do a call() with e.g. the kombu driver, and there is no consumer
listening, then you will get a Timeout exception.

However, with the fake driver, we just silently return None in this
case. The oslo.messaging fake driver instead raises a Timeout and this
behaviour change turned up a tonne of issues with Nova's unit tests.

Make this change here too so that we can merge fixes for Nova's tests
before porting to oslo.messaging.

Note that although we also raise a Timeout in the case of cast(), but
cast() then just ignores the exception.

I'd add a test for this, but it appears we don't have any unit tests for
the fake driver.

Change-Id: Id14534ea5aff4ab2a27d31ca6f0ad2f2a8d273c8
"}]
commit_message:
Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found

If you do a call() with e.g. the kombu driver, and there is no consumer
listening, then you will get a Timeout exception.

However, with the fake driver, we just silently return None in this
case. The oslo.messaging fake driver instead raises a Timeout and this
behaviour change turned up a tonne of issues with Nova's unit tests.

Make this change here too so that we can merge fixes for Nova's tests
before porting to oslo.messaging.

Note that although we also raise a Timeout in the case of cast(), but
cast() then just ignores the exception.

I'd add a test for this, but it appears we don't have any unit tests for
the fake driver.

Change-Id: Id14534ea5aff4ab2a27d31ca6f0ad2f2a8d273c8

commit_message:
Use functools.wrap() instead of custom implementation

In openstack.db.sqlalchemy.session.py:_wrap_db_err() we used
custom implementation of functools.wrap(). So this patch remove
custom implementation and use functools.wrap().

Closes-Bug: #1119726

Change-Id: Ic92658647bc37d81a819581128fec675ad545c4a

commit_message:
Add per-owner number of images limit

Add 'image_count_cap' parameter which limits the number
of images that a particular owner can create.

The thinking here is to prevent a runaway script from
unintentionally filling up the database.

Change-Id: Ibee764e4a23435ea4cb32f6cb50762f6d96a3ead

commit_message:
Don't append %interface with ipv6 ips.

- Since netifaces is appending a %interface (i.e: %eth0) at the end and
  does not make a correct ipv6 address we are removing it.
- Improve the tests of whataremyips along the way.

Closes-Bug: 1209443
Change-Id: I585e795083783009961b429607ca3f66b8d7ec30

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-20 09:37:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-baremetal'], 'message': "Remove non-baremetal flavors in setup-baremetal.

Currently it's impossible to mix baremetal and non-baremetal
hypervisors. We could leave the flavors intact, but that just makes it
possible for users to shoot themselves in the foot trying to boot
instances on them.

Change-Id: I7f60d0449f2881702574527c8ddb34526aaea8f4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove non-baremetal flavors in setup-baremetal.

Currently it's impossible to mix baremetal and non-baremetal
hypervisors. We could leave the flavors intact, but that just makes it
possible for users to shoot themselves in the foot trying to boot
instances on them.

Change-Id: I7f60d0449f2881702574527c8ddb34526aaea8f4

commit_message:
Register API endpoints from outside the clouds.

Another step in our principled separation, this adds a small wrapper
to register-endpoint to register all the endpoints for a control
plane.

commit_message:
Add helper script to register endpoints.

Endpoint registration is something we should be managing via APIs
rather than in-instance scripts becausemachines often don't know their
externally visible addresses, and APIs are often behind haproxy or
other proxies.

Change-Id: I26c59fc069cb57146e7ebb7c19b70c1ce0e77a01

subject: Use single meta when change column type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-08 14:55:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py'], 'message': "Use single meta when change column type

Function _change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite() from module
openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.utils uses get_table() function to get
required Table object. Function get_table() creates a MetaData object and
returns the Table instance using this metadata. When function
`_change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite` creates new table, it
also create new MetaData() objects.
It's works fine in most cases, but when table has foreign key, there is
no possibility to find related table for new table because related table
absent in new metadata.

To fix this issue we get metadata from received Table object.
Test added.

Fixes bug 1210163

Change-Id: I9c441d263e6e87fce702b12f5d2c4a9144cfb7e4
"}]
commit_message:
Use single meta when change column type

Function _change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite() from module
openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.utils uses get_table() function to get
required Table object. Function get_table() creates a MetaData object and
returns the Table instance using this metadata. When function
`_change_deleted_column_type_to_boolean_sqlite` creates new table, it
also create new MetaData() objects.
It's works fine in most cases, but when table has foreign key, there is
no possibility to find related table for new table because related table
absent in new metadata.

To fix this issue we get metadata from received Table object.
Test added.

Fixes bug 1210163

Change-Id: I9c441d263e6e87fce702b12f5d2c4a9144cfb7e4

subject: Standardize on ID for log messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 21:06:30.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': "Standardize on ID for log messages

We have some places where logs use name to identify
a volume and others where we use ID.  Let's standardize
on the UUID here as that's typically the unique identifier
we use in most places anyway.  Even though name is a
derviative it seems better to be consistent with this
and use the UUID by itself.

Change-Id: Iaee3d146042780e4a526834db1e0be84a705f24b
Fixes: bug 1214140
"}]
commit_message:
Standardize on ID for log messages

We have some places where logs use name to identify
a volume and others where we use ID.  Let's standardize
on the UUID here as that's typically the unique identifier
we use in most places anyway.  Even though name is a
derviative it seems better to be consistent with this
and use the UUID by itself.

Change-Id: Iaee3d146042780e4a526834db1e0be84a705f24b
Fixes: bug 1214140

commit_message:
Reduce hidden effects of sqlalchemy objects

The flows are currently holding onto sqlalchemy
due to bug #1214083 and this is causing a problem
with gettextutils which appears to be deepcopying
the raw objects, of which one of those is sqlalchemy
objects, which can't seem to be deepcopied.

Change-Id: Ie831738799a75e2a4a652c73900cad353a71e327

subject: Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-20 03:13:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/023_raw_template_mysql_longtext.py'], 'message': "Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL

TEXT in PostgreSQL is an unlimited column size. However, in MySQL, it is
limited to 2^16 bytes. LONGTEXT allows 2^32 bytes, which is overkill,
but will prevent MySQL from silently truncating this column and thus
rendering the entire tenant's API access moot.

Fixes bug #1210799

Change-Id: Ib2b379db32a8296cf8c5a2434e7615afc59288e3
"}]
commit_message:
Use LONGTEXT for templates in MySQL

TEXT in PostgreSQL is an unlimited column size. However, in MySQL, it is
limited to 2^16 bytes. LONGTEXT allows 2^32 bytes, which is overkill,
but will prevent MySQL from silently truncating this column and thus
rendering the entire tenant's API access moot.

Fixes bug #1210799

Change-Id: Ib2b379db32a8296cf8c5a2434e7615afc59288e3

commit_message:
Set file permission to be executable.

When ramdisk-image-create is called with the hwdiscovery element,
it failed to install hwinfo package.

The root reason is 10-hwinfo is not executable, the fix is to
set the file permission of 10-hwinfo to be executable.

Change-Id: I3a57147103f607b3975eb6ad23a44475f26c2f1e

subject: Add caching ability to boot-seed-vm
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-20 08:25:07.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': "Add caching ability to boot-seed-vm

Currently boot-seed-vm creates a new image each time it is run, users
who want to restart a new identical seed VM shouldn't need to create it
again from scratch a second time.

This commit gives users the option to cache the seed image so it can be
reused again without a costly call to di-b to create a new one.

Change-Id: Ib8174227cf6e16ae59a64ef396b6a3c5f125be4e
"}]
commit_message:
Add caching ability to boot-seed-vm

Currently boot-seed-vm creates a new image each time it is run, users
who want to restart a new identical seed VM shouldn't need to create it
again from scratch a second time.

This commit gives users the option to cache the seed image so it can be
reused again without a costly call to di-b to create a new one.

Change-Id: Ib8174227cf6e16ae59a64ef396b6a3c5f125be4e

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-19 06:20:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Make auth_token middleware fetching respect prefix

In auth_token middleware auth_prefix is only added to requests that go
through the _json_request method. This doesn't include the two
certificate fetching functions. Manually add the auth_prefix to both
those requests.

Change-Id: I25d1b401598c9a443ddef0fc3259ba859aee8c76
"}]
commit_message:
Make auth_token middleware fetching respect prefix

In auth_token middleware auth_prefix is only added to requests that go
through the _json_request method. This doesn't include the two
certificate fetching functions. Manually add the auth_prefix to both
those requests.

Closes-Bug: #1211615
Change-Id: I25d1b401598c9a443ddef0fc3259ba859aee8c76

subject: run_tests.sh can not install Python package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-10 12:31:17.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'run_tests.sh can not install Python package

On Ubuntu 12.04, while running run_tests.sh in /opt/stack/nova,
it will install the virtual environment firstly. The Python packages
listed in requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt should be
installed properly. But we need to install 3 packages to pass it:

libxslt1-dev
libmysqlclient-dev
libpq-dev

It is better to install them while installing nova in devstack.

Change-Id: I7ee9427513da98498f39cc16649c4aa7f22824a4
'}]
commit_message:
run_tests.sh can not install Python package

On Ubuntu 12.04, while running run_tests.sh in /opt/stack/nova,
it will install the virtual environment firstly. The Python packages
listed in requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt should be
installed properly. But we need to install 3 packages to pass it:

libxslt1-dev
libmysqlclient-dev
libpq-dev

It is better to install them while installing nova in devstack.

Change-Id: I7ee9427513da98498f39cc16649c4aa7f22824a4

In file keystone/common/openssl.py,
