commit_message:
Assignment to reserved built-in symbol: dir

In file keystone/common/openssl.py,
BaseCertificateConfigure::_make_dirs(), built-in symbol dir was
re-assignment as local vars, it is easily lead to a misunderstanding, so
rename them.
This patch do not modify any functionality.

Change-Id: I70d6bdc9362577b46b3500de49603f296b6b72e1

Set the image_meta for the instance booted from a volume

If the VM is booted from a volume, image_meta should be retrieved from the field
volume_image_metadata in volume.

Fixed Bug 1191069.

Change-Id: I4df185ab5eeb819327606163565501c845411a7e

In the cookbook-openstack-network/recipes/common.rb, for "openvswitch",
it restarts the service quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent. But it doen't

commit_message:
remove restarting quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent

In the cookbook-openstack-network/recipes/common.rb, for "openvswitch",
it restarts the service quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent. But it doen't
install the quantum_openvswitch_agent_packages at first. It does not expect
to install openvswitch package or the agent. So I remove the restart action
from the common.rb

Fixes: Bug #1210400
Implements: remove the action to restart the quantum-plugin-openvswitch-agent
Change-Id: Idd22fee926649583653b7d53b8b0bc0ca8eacd07

the FAULT_MAP in neutron/api/v2/base.py maps NotAuthorized
exception to HTTPForbidden, however HTTPUnauthorized can be more
precise.

NOTE: function _validate_network_tenant_ownership() will raise
HTTPForbidden directly when non-admin user tries to create port or
subnet on a network which is owned by another tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1210343

Change-Id: I249109afa31686cbfa74301b0728fd1e9afefa90
'}]
commit_message:
Map NotAuthorized exception to HTTPUnauthorized

the FAULT_MAP in neutron/api/v2/base.py maps NotAuthorized
exception to HTTPForbidden, however HTTPUnauthorized can be more
precise.

NOTE: function _validate_network_tenant_ownership() will raise
HTTPForbidden directly when non-admin user tries to create port or
subnet on a network which is owned by another tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1210343

Change-Id: I249109afa31686cbfa74301b0728fd1e9afefa90

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rhel/pre-install.d/01-install-bin', 'elements/rhel/root.d/10-rhel-cloud-image', 'elements/rhel/pre-install.d/00-allow-root-sudo', 'elements/rhel/pre-install.d/00-usr-local-bin-secure-path', 'elements/rhel/bin/install-packages', 'elements/rhel/pre-install.d/00-rhsm', 'lib/common-functions', 'elements/rhel/README.md', 'elements/rhel/element-deps', 'elements/rhel/bin/map-packages', 'elements/rhel/pre-install.d/02-lsb', 'elements/rhel/post-install.d/05-fstab-rootfs-label', 'elements/rhel/finalise.d/11-selinux-fixfiles-restore', 'elements/rhel/post-install.d/06-network-config-nonzeroconf', 'elements/rhel/pre-install.d/01-override-yum-arch', 'elements/vm/block-device.d/10-partition'], 'message': "Adding rhel installation element

Adding RHEL support for partitioning

RHEL 6 doesn't create /dev/loop*p* devices for partitions. It does
use device mapper to create the device under /dev/mapper/loop*p*.

This patch adds a common functioon to figure out what operating
system disk image builder is being run on, then decides where to look
for the loop partition.

Change-Id: I5e6ca75de6ab2267486af8b35b76f20c2f17a5e4
"}]
commit_message:
Adding rhel installation element

Adding RHEL support for partitioning

RHEL 6 doesn't create /dev/loop*p* devices for partitions. It does
use device mapper to create the device under /dev/mapper/loop*p*.

This patch adds a common functioon to figure out what operating
system disk image builder is being run on, then decides where to look
for the loop partition.

Change-Id: I5e6ca75de6ab2267486af8b35b76f20c2f17a5e4

subject: Don't pass RPC connection to pre_start_hook
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-08-19 10:52:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/service.py', 'nova/tests/test_service.py', 'nova/manager.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't pass RPC connection to pre_start_hook

In review I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b (commit 3349417) we
passed an rpc_connection argument to pre_start_hook() so that we could
create additional queues.

See review Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3 for how this was
intended to be used. With oslo.messaging, we'd support doing something
like this by adding support for multiple targets to RPCServer since the
concept of a messaging connection isn't really exposed by the API in
quite the same way.

In any case, this rpc_connection parameter has never been used since it
was introduced, so let's remove it. Let's also move the invocation of
this hook back to where it originally was.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I9181a3567a1b5a8a6077e78c85f4d28660f275a6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't pass RPC connection to pre_start_hook

In review I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b (commit 3349417) we
passed an rpc_connection argument to pre_start_hook() so that we could
create additional queues.

See review Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3 for how this was
intended to be used. With oslo.messaging, we'd support doing something
like this by adding support for multiple targets to RPCServer since the
concept of a messaging connection isn't really exposed by the API in
quite the same way.

In any case, this rpc_connection parameter has never been used since it
was introduced, so let's remove it. Let's also move the invocation of
this hook back to where it originally was.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I9181a3567a1b5a8a6077e78c85f4d28660f275a6

The migration for the ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver was incorrectly setting
primary key attributes on separate lines for 'ip_address' and
'udp_port'. Also, a primary key cannot have autoincrement set, so

commit_message:
Fix ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver DB migration

The migration for the ML2 VXLAN TypeDriver was incorrectly setting
primary key attributes on separate lines for 'ip_address' and
'udp_port'. Also, a primary key cannot have autoincrement set, so
add this to 'udp_port' as well.

Fixes bug 1213134

Change-Id: I0b2e2685bf524dd9c0333ac4511287ad6a5eb87e

subject: Remove unnecessary sql checks.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 05:05:30.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/sql.py'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary sql checks.

We don't need to check that the user and group exists before checking if
the user is in the group. If the user or group does not exist then there
shouldn't be an entry for it in the user_group_membership table.

Change-Id: I9fba342aafba198460b5f3db17551b656b1a02a1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary sql checks.

We don't need to check that the user and group exists before checking if
the user is in the group. If the user or group does not exist then there
shouldn't be an entry for it in the user_group_membership table.

Change-Id: I9fba342aafba198460b5f3db17551b656b1a02a1

subject: Sync py3kcompat from oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-20 00:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/limits.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/flavors.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/images.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/security_groups.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/hypervisors.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/servers.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/floating_ip_dns.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/volumes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'Sync py3kcompat from oslo

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several
functions to different modules and combined modules. Six
provides a consistent interface to the module through
six.moves

However urllib/urlparse is not covered by six.moves so
py3kcompat adds python2/python3 compatibility layer for
urllib/urlparse.

As well as StringIO and CstringIO modules do not exist
in python3, here we use six.moves to take care of this
compatibility between python2/python3.

Change-Id: I577b9b2e7badacd8567e40020d2514b3c6ab76a8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Sync py3kcompat from oslo

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several
functions to different modules and combined modules. Six
provides a consistent interface to the module through
six.moves

However urllib/urlparse is not covered by six.moves so
py3kcompat adds python2/python3 compatibility layer for
urllib/urlparse.

As well as StringIO and CstringIO modules do not exist
in python3, here we use six.moves to take care of this
compatibility between python2/python3.

Change-Id: I577b9b2e7badacd8567e40020d2514b3c6ab76a8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: python3: Fix imports for py2/py3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 12:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/limits.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/flavors.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/images.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/security_groups.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/hypervisors.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/servers.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/floating_ip_dns.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/volumes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Id5aaed9fc9ac4ec0389b19748943225a26c37f2c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Id5aaed9fc9ac4ec0389b19748943225a26c37f2c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Store hash of access as primary key for ec2 type.

In current v3 credential implementation when
a new ec2 credential is created we store it with
new credential id in the backend. This fix is provided
to store the hash of access key id as credential
id when a new ec2 v3 credential is created.

Fixes Bug #1185582

Change-Id: I0ad9aaa3282b101adb6228582f0d24349232ce18

subject: Remove kwargs from manager calls / general cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-08-17 08:03:04.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/core.py', 'keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/trust/core.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py', 'keystone/trust/controllers.py', 'keystone/contrib/oauth1/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Remove kwargs from manager calls / general cleanup

Cleaned up keystone.trust.controllers.TrustV3.delete_trust to use
the proper "delete_tokens" method from the token_api.

Added "delete_trust" reference method to keystone.trust.core.Driver.

Named-argument cleanup:

This patch removes some use of kwargs from manager calls where not
required. Dogpile.cache (the targeted caching library) does not
support kwargs out of the box with its cache-key-generator. This
change allows us to support the default cache-key-generator.

Cleanup done on a couple calls in keystone.assignment.core to remove
un-needed named-arguments.

Added a note on keystone.token.core.Driver indicating that
list_tokens should be considered a private method only used by
"delete_tokens" and if treated as such, should not need caching.

In keystone.common.controller.V3Controller._get_domain_id_for_request
fixed named-argument call to token_api.get_token

In keystone.contrib.oauth1.controllers.OAuthControllerV3.authorize
fixed named-argument call to token_api.get_token

partial-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls
Change-Id: I1fddb4e2db9a24a9ebc544aabe63a3b1fdcfc374
'}]
commit_message:
Remove kwargs from manager calls / general cleanup

Cleaned up keystone.trust.controllers.TrustV3.delete_trust to use
the proper "delete_tokens" method from the token_api.

Added "delete_trust" reference method to keystone.trust.core.Driver.

Named-argument cleanup:

This patch removes some use of kwargs from manager calls where not
required. Dogpile.cache (the targeted caching library) does not
support kwargs out of the box with its cache-key-generator. This
change allows us to support the default cache-key-generator.

Cleanup done on a couple calls in keystone.assignment.core to remove
un-needed named-arguments.

Added a note on keystone.token.core.Driver indicating that
list_tokens should be considered a private method only used by
"delete_tokens" and if treated as such, should not need caching.

In keystone.common.controller.V3Controller._get_domain_id_for_request
fixed named-argument call to token_api.get_token

In keystone.contrib.oauth1.controllers.OAuthControllerV3.authorize
fixed named-argument call to token_api.get_token

partial-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls
Change-Id: I1fddb4e2db9a24a9ebc544aabe63a3b1fdcfc374

commit_message:
Refactor Token Providers for better version interfaces

Cleanup Token Providers to provider a cleaner interface for the
various token versions. Removal of named-arguments/kwargs is
for future caching capabilities.  Due to overhead and problems
with both generating consistent cache keys and invalidates
moving to an "arg" model is better for the manager calls.

Change-Id: I45764ade8bf726c57bf44dba783175bfac5032b4
blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-07-30 01:47:31.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'swift/container/sync.py', 'doc/source/development_saio.rst', 'test/unit/common/test_networking.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'setup.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'requirements.txt', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/common/networking.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'swift/account/reaper.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Removed netifaces dependecy.

This was used for the "whataremyips" function. This function is now
implemented using a custom CFFI binding to the underlying POSIX APIs. This was
done for two reasons:

a) netifaces is not hosted on PyPi and requires scraping to find it, this
   presents both a reliability and security risk
b) netifaces doesn't work on PyPy since it is a CPython C-extension, the new
   cffi code works on both CPython and PyPy.

This code has only been tested on OS X thus far, but is based on some Twisted
code (licensed in a compatible fashion) which is said to work on any POSIX
platform. If a Windows implementation is needed, one can be written.

Change-Id: I0449270d926b91679b7b43f334d61d273c643685
'}]
commit_message:
Removed netifaces dependecy.

This was used for the "whataremyips" function. This function is now
implemented using a custom CFFI binding to the underlying POSIX APIs. This was
done for two reasons:

a) netifaces is not hosted on PyPi and requires scraping to find it, this
   presents both a reliability and security risk
b) netifaces doesn't work on PyPy since it is a CPython C-extension, the new
   cffi code works on both CPython and PyPy.

This code has only been tested on OS X thus far, but is based on some Twisted
code (licensed in a compatible fashion) which is said to work on any POSIX
platform. If a Windows implementation is needed, one can be written.

Change-Id: I0449270d926b91679b7b43f334d61d273c643685

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 191, 'name': 'Trey Morris', 'email': 'trey.morris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tr3buchet'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-14 00:28:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py'], 'message': 'Handle NeutronClientException in secgroup create

When networking is provided by Neutron and a security group or a security group
rules quota is exceeded, we get a NeutronClientException with status_code 409
and message "NeutronClientException: Quota exceeded for resources"

This patch updates the neutron security group driver to handle this exception
and translate it to nova's SecurityGroupLimitExceeded

Change-Id: I0fa57b02694221507885ab4bfdb5805e936450e2
Fixes: bug #1209446
'}]
commit_message:
Handle NeutronClientException in secgroup create

When networking is provided by Neutron and a security group or a security group
rules quota is exceeded, we get a NeutronClientException with status_code 409
and message "NeutronClientException: Quota exceeded for resources"

This patch updates the neutron security group driver to handle this exception
and translate it to nova's SecurityGroupLimitExceeded

test_neutron_driver is also updated to provide unit tests for this patch

Change-Id: I0fa57b02694221507885ab4bfdb5805e936450e2
Fixes: bug #1209446

commit_message:
Primarily updating CLI to support V2

V2 image cli operations build help text based on the jsonschema.
Supporting this as cleanly as possible required quite a bit of
refactoring, making this a larger commit than might otherwise be
expected.

This also allowed for more and deeper testing, so there are a lot
of new and rewritten tests as well.

Change-Id: I24aed0863689f85898b4bf0b68472a8356280fe2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-09 21:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/tests/network/test_network_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Add ssh check to quantum smoke test.

 * Doing a ping check to verify that a vm is reachable may result
   in a false positive if the target ip is routed in error to a
   nonetheless pingable host.  This patch adds an ssh check that will
   fail if the target is not configured with the expected (and
   dynamically generated) ssh keypair.
 * Adding the ssh check uncovered a bug in security group creation -
   source group rules were being used that restricted traffic to
   ports associated with the security group.  This is now fixed.
 * Addresses bug 1182343

Conflicts:
	tempest/scenario/manager.py
	tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py

Change-Id: I6b7910f79615335fc50a2e731ed3b57c23bc6b13
(cherry picked from commit af292e8eb7c5318541eb6e88ccde7d5b7c00cb71)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ssh check to quantum smoke test.

 * Doing a ping check to verify that a vm is reachable may result
   in a false positive if the target ip is routed in error to a
   nonetheless pingable host.  This patch adds an ssh check that will
   fail if the target is not configured with the expected (and
   dynamically generated) ssh keypair.
 * Adding the ssh check uncovered a bug in security group creation -
   source group rules were being used that restricted traffic to
   ports associated with the security group.  This is now fixed.
 * Addresses bug 1182343

Conflicts:
	tempest/scenario/manager.py
	tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py

Change-Id: I6b7910f79615335fc50a2e731ed3b57c23bc6b13
(cherry picked from commit af292e8eb7c5318541eb6e88ccde7d5b7c00cb71)

subject: testr should not run in parallel unless all the testcases get fixed.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 15:33:36.000000000', 'files': ['run-tests.sh'], 'message': "testr should not run in parallel unless all the testcases get fixed.

There are many test cases in tests/storage/base.py use same data
inserted into the database for tests, however, when multiple test
cases run at the same time, the data in the database are is
nondeterministic consider the setup and teardown get called many
times. This patch will simply make sure that they won't run parallel.
Other fixes could be using the group_by clause from testr to group
not-process safe test cases together so that at least other test
cases can run parallel.

fixes Bug #1213943

Change-Id: I6cffd2c13908de7927782879bcb4ee6fb738a22d
"}]
commit_message:
testr should not run in parallel unless all the testcases get fixed.

There are many test cases in tests/storage/base.py use same data
inserted into the database for tests, however, when multiple test
cases run at the same time, the data in the database are is
nondeterministic consider the setup and teardown get called many
times. This patch will simply make sure that they won't run parallel.
Other fixes could be using the group_by clause from testr to group
not-process safe test cases together so that at least other test
cases can run parallel.

fixes Bug #1213943

Change-Id: I6cffd2c13908de7927782879bcb4ee6fb738a22d

subject: fix: bad marker behaves like non-existing marker
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-16 13:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/storage/sqlite/utils.py', 'marconi/storage/exceptions.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/messages.py', 'marconi/tests/transport/wsgi/test_messages.py', 'marconi/transport/wsgi/messages.py', 'marconi/tests/storage/base.py'], 'message': 'fix: bad marker behaves like non-existing marker

From the point of view of the interface, a marker should has only
two states: returning some messages, or returning no messages.
Currently a malformed message marker results in a 400 response,
which makes the marker no longer opaque.

This patch makes the transport respond 204 for a malformed marker
by making storage return an empty iterator in such a case:

  GET /queues/q/messages?marker=malformed  ->  204

This patch also include some clean up on test code.

Change-Id: I1ac7d4bb42af1644bd16d6bca6b7c50a1d700e10
Closes-Bug: #1212389
'}]
commit_message:
fix: bad marker behaves like non-existing marker

From the point of view of the interface, a marker should has only
two states: returning some messages, or returning no messages.
Currently a malformed message marker results in a 400 response,
which makes the marker no longer opaque.

This patch makes the transport respond 204 for a malformed marker
by making storage return an empty iterator in such a case:

  GET /queues/q/messages?marker=malformed  ->  204

This patch also include some clean up on test code.

Change-Id: I1ac7d4bb42af1644bd16d6bca6b7c50a1d700e10
Closes-Bug: #1212389

subject: Revert "Implement apiclient library"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-14 04:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/apiclient/auth.py', 'openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'tests/unit/apiclient/test_base.py', 'openstack/common/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'openstack/common/apiclient/client.py', 'openstack/common/apiclient/fake_client.py', 'tests/unit/apiclient/test_auth.py', 'tests/unit/apiclient/test_exceptions.py', 'tests/unit/apiclient/test_client.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Implement apiclient library"

This reverts commit 062cc24f5dfc8e1652a589f6a2f45ce8f3a1b89c.

The apiclient is a very important idea.  However, that authentication
portion is highly likely to have security updates required in the
future, and having a copied section of code in multiple client
libraries will make patching difficult.

The implementation for this approach has been targetted for the
keystoneclient library, with the understanding that the keystoneclient
will then be used by the other clients to perform authentication.

The code as commited here has not yet been vetted in Keystoneclient.
There are some identified changes that will have to happen before it
is integrated there.  Thus, the version of code that is included in
this repository would have been incorrect very quickly.

The one change not removed with this revert is the addition of the
requests library to requirements.txt.  Removing that change now will
cause test failures elsewhere.

Change-Id: I593316dd3a722e6fdcb38409be4a2f0ca3bb3caf
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Implement apiclient library"

This reverts commit 062cc24f5dfc8e1652a589f6a2f45ce8f3a1b89c.

The apiclient is a very important idea.  However, that authentication
portion is highly likely to have security updates required in the
future, and having a copied section of code in multiple client
libraries will make patching difficult.

The implementation for this approach has been targetted for the
keystoneclient library, with the understanding that the keystoneclient
will then be used by the other clients to perform authentication.

The code as commited here has not yet been vetted in Keystoneclient.
There are some identified changes that will have to happen before it
is integrated there.  Thus, the version of code that is included in
this repository would have been incorrect very quickly.

The one change not removed with this revert is the addition of the
requests library to requirements.txt.  Removing that change now will
cause test failures elsewhere.

Change-Id: I593316dd3a722e6fdcb38409be4a2f0ca3bb3caf

commit_message:
Add "Invalid TLD" error message

Currently, when creating a domain, if the TLD doesn't match,
the error message returned is "invalid domain name". An error
of "Invalid TLD" would be clearer to the user.

Change-Id: Ic5a8f38aff298b1fbe1b05c4abb505beacb54e2b
Fixes: bug #1208874

subject: Enable SNAT by default in L3 agents
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-19 06:42:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Enable SNAT by default in L3 agents

If ext-gw-mode extension isn't supported by plugin, it won't
return enable_snat param in router info. Agent will currently
default to enable_snat = false, which changes from expected
default behaviour prior to ext-gw-mode introduction.

This patch changes L3 agent to enable SNAT by default if plugin
doesn't support ext-gw-mode extension.

Change-Id: I35e8f8c20392bff9ac2f875f2c9a1038ab06ad7b
Closes-Bug: #1212868
"}]
commit_message:
Enable SNAT by default in L3 agents

If ext-gw-mode extension isn't supported by plugin, it won't
return enable_snat param in router info. Agent will currently
default to enable_snat = false, which changes from expected
default behaviour prior to ext-gw-mode introduction.

This patch changes L3 agent to enable SNAT by default if plugin
doesn't support ext-gw-mode extension.

Change-Id: I35e8f8c20392bff9ac2f875f2c9a1038ab06ad7b
Closes-Bug: #1212868

subject: Add passing a logging level to processutils.execute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-16 14:28:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/processutils.py'], 'message': 'Add passing a logging level to processutils.execute

Previously, processutils.execute always logged what commands were
run at DEBUG level.  This is usually fine, but sometimes the caller
wants to log particularly important commands at INFO level instead,
and oslo should allow that.

This is oslo-incubator aa5b65882.  No other significant changes had
been made to processutils in oslo since the last sync.

Change-Id: I09dad3759bf2f759b297ee19205cf0460b9a6baa
'}]
commit_message:
Add passing a logging level to processutils.execute

Previously, processutils.execute always logged what commands were
run at DEBUG level.  This is usually fine, but sometimes the caller
wants to log particularly important commands at INFO level instead,
and oslo should allow that.

This is oslo-incubator aa5b65882.  No other significant changes had
been made to processutils in oslo since the last sync.

Change-Id: I09dad3759bf2f759b297ee19205cf0460b9a6baa

commit_message:
Set BigSwitch plugin to use existing host database model

The BigSwitch plugin had a data model duplicating one
that was recently added into the base portbindings db
file. This patch removes the BigSwitch model and
updates the BigSwitch plugin to reference the plugin-
agnostic model.

Fixes: bug #1211641
Change-Id: I1fdbf8690e71fb2d6e9d6a6dbd0571fa2c32a7e0

commit_message:
fix invalid python-requests<=1.2.2 pinning

The stated reason for the original pin was invalid
as it used <1.2.3 rather than <=1.2.3

Therefore sync to the global requirements change to
remove the upper bound entirely.

Change-Id: Ifb59c0d5eb7fed48b01c67ec19dc79e79657fe2d

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-08-18 17:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/nova_notifier.py', 'nova_tests/test_notifier.py'], 'message': 'Fixes failed notification when deleting instance

In the notifier plugin for nova, the class Instance that translates instance_ref
returned by conduct.API to nova_client like Instance is not very robust, which
results some attributes are none or missing, and then causes pollsters raise
AttributeError or NoneTypeError

In this change, add the missing or none attributes to the Instance class.

Change-Id: I3e5aa6382021633a6bf7240bf58d3c3bed074785
Fixs: bug #1206731
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes failed notification when deleting instance

In the notifier plugin for nova, the class Instance that translates instance_ref
returned by conduct.API to nova_client like Instance is not very robust, which
results some attributes are none or missing, and then causes pollsters raise
AttributeError or NoneTypeError

In this change, add the missing or none attributes to the Instance class.

Change-Id: I3e5aa6382021633a6bf7240bf58d3c3bed074785
Fixs: bug #1206731

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-08-19 02:58:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/210_fix_project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_index.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Fix project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index

The project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index in the 203 migration
for the project_user_quotas table was using the wrong column, it should
be using user_id instead of project_id since there is already an index
for the project_id column (defined directly above it).

Change-Id: I6899afe5b57432345f69b4ee91ef947a4b9ef5c9

commit_message:
Fix project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index

The project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx index in the 203 migration
for the project_user_quotas table was using the wrong column, it should
be using user_id instead of project_id since there is already an index
for the project_id column (defined directly above it).

Fixes bug 1205693

Change-Id: I6899afe5b57432345f69b4ee91ef947a4b9ef5c9

and exit prematurely.

commit_message:
fix broken WSDL logic

vSphere driver incorrectly assumes that a WSDL is locally required.
A local WSDL is only needed as a work-around for certain situations.

Fixes bug 1171215

(cherry picked from commit cf3cc74fcb65de3c59f98db001267e05ae405186)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py

Change-Id: I1e17ee54e668eafc3d9d9c9746d996cd66063251

subject: python3: Fix imports for py2/py3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-15 13:25:58.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/limits.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/flavors.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/images.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/security_groups.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/hypervisors.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/servers.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/floating_ip_dns.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/volumes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Ia89c0fbc0fe7059b7bb95d701084a0de014287b7
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix imports for py2/py3

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so we do it via
py3kcompat.

Change-Id: Ia89c0fbc0fe7059b7bb95d701084a0de014287b7
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Don't call publisher without sample
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-08-19 06:52:34.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/pipeline.py', 'ceilometer/publisher/test.py', 'tests/test_pipeline.py'], 'message': "Don't call publisher without sample

Actually when you push samples into a pipeline, and the publishers don't
care of this sample, the publisher is called with a empty array of
samples.

This cause to send unuseful rpc/udp message.

With this change, the publisher is called only when it is needed.

Change-Id: I5811ead70808825e56cf9224b4db888c39034e35
"}]
commit_message:
Don't call publisher without sample

Actually when you push samples into a pipeline, and the publishers don't
care of this sample, the publisher is called with a empty array of
samples.

This cause to send unuseful rpc/udp message.

With this change, the publisher is called only when it is needed.

Change-Id: I5811ead70808825e56cf9224b4db888c39034e35

subject: Handle instance directories correctly for migrates.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-11 16:45:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fake_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': "Handle instance directories correctly for migrates.

In Grizzly we changed how we name instance directories. Unfortunately
the decision as to what directory name to use is based on whether
there is a pre-existing directory on the compute node with the old
name.

In the case of live migration, that doesn't work because we have
libvirt copy the directory across for us. So, we need to pass
around the directory name in the migration request. This is better
anyway, as it means that ops types don't need to handle an instance
directory magically renaming itself at some point.

Resolves bug 1175286.

Change-Id: Ib102e644a8742726fa2049303354d466b8109e0b
(cherry picked from commit 5c11a8c537eb4349e02e8f42468b441c259fbfc2)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle instance directories correctly for migrates.

In Grizzly we changed how we name instance directories. Unfortunately
the decision as to what directory name to use is based on whether
there is a pre-existing directory on the compute node with the old
name.

In the case of live migration, that doesn't work because we have
libvirt copy the directory across for us. So, we need to pass
around the directory name in the migration request. This is better
anyway, as it means that ops types don't need to handle an instance
directory magically renaming itself at some point.

Resolves bug 1175286.

Change-Id: Ib102e644a8742726fa2049303354d466b8109e0b
(cherry picked from commit 5c11a8c537eb4349e02e8f42468b441c259fbfc2)

subject: Raise error when period with negative value
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-15 23:34:39.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'tests/api/v2/test_statistics_scenarios.py'], 'message': 'Raise error when period with negative value

Based on current implement, when use launch below REST API:
GET http://10.1.0.175:8777/v2/meters/port/statistics?period=-1
The result will be 200 OK. No any error reports. This query
should not allow negative value setting but 400 error, and
prompts like this: "Period must be positive.". Just like
setting "Limit" to negative.

Fixes bug 1212159

Change-Id: I8d547fdf8faae2094b24c81da6b233b432bc99ae
'}]
commit_message:
Raise error when period with negative value

Based on current implement, when use launch below REST API:
GET http://10.1.0.175:8777/v2/meters/port/statistics?period=-1
The result will be 200 OK. No any error reports. This query
should not allow negative value setting but 400 error, and
prompts like this: "Period must be positive.". Just like
setting "Limit" to negative.

Fixes bug 1212159

Change-Id: I8d547fdf8faae2094b24c81da6b233b432bc99ae

commit_message:
Reinitialize pipeline manager for service restart

For central and compute agent, they need to reinitialize
pipeline manager for service restart.
It depends on blueprint service-restart of oslo-incubator and
blueprint cfg-reload-config-files of oslo.config.

Implements blueprint pollster-runtime-configuration

Change-Id: Icf2597392222d6d97b3dbfd7d48e5ac3b84b175e

commit_message:
Fix available zone issue

If a host already added to one aggregation which belongs to one
available zone, then the host should still be allowed to add to
another aggregation if the aggregation does not belong to any
available zone.

Fix bug 1213211

Change-Id: I7a4df14709179eab905b1ea5aa772850c73b8fd8

commit_message:
Reformat help outputs

Reformatted the help outputs in the swift client to bring them more
in line with the rest of the openstack clients. Changes were added to
all of the st_command_help variables and a new variable
st_command_options was added to help with correct formatting of
help outputs.

Patchset #3 fixed st_post_options value to display the correct
help message.

Change-Id: Ic76e7fb567ced0cfa268a61a6ac720e7ac8b5b1e
Implements: changes to help outputs

subject: Also Catch errors from RPC during live migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-26 01:22:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/manager.py'], 'message': 'Also Catch errors from RPC during live migrations

These get bubbled up from the conductor as RemoteErrors, and are
easily triggered due to user error.  Not handling them results in
instances getting permanently stuck in a "Migrating" state.

Change-Id: I9c5ca64a0413c6fe427dd0377bea297b65fdc3b6
Fixes: Bug 1171526
'}]
commit_message:
Also Catch errors from RPC during live migrations

These get bubbled up from the conductor as RemoteErrors, and are
easily triggered due to user error.  Not handling them results in
instances getting permanently stuck in a "Migrating" state.

Change-Id: I9c5ca64a0413c6fe427dd0377bea297b65fdc3b6
Fixes: Bug 1171526

subject: V2 Client Token Validation.
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2013-08-06 03:18:14.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/v2_0/client.py', 'keystoneclient/utils.py', 'tests/v2_0/test_validate.py', 'tests/test_utils.py', 'keystoneclient/exceptions.py', 'tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystoneclient/httpclient.py', 'keystoneclient/v2_0/tokens.py', 'tests/token_data.py', 'keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py', 'keystoneclient/service_catalog.py'], 'message': 'V2 Client Token Validation.

Implement token validation within the v2 client. Creates a number of
utils functions that extracts functionality from auth_token middleware.
Rearrange the token data from the auth_token middleware tests so that we
can reuse it for validation tests.

This is the first part of bp keystoneclient-auth-token

commit_message:
V2 Client Token Validation.

Implement token validation within the v2 client. Creates a number of
utils functions that extracts functionality from auth_token middleware.
Rearrange the token data from the auth_token middleware tests so that we
can reuse it for validation tests.

This is the first part of bp keystoneclient-auth-token

Change-Id: Ia6d8028cf4c4ee5c0d2e17e7fad5fb3299a68aae

subject: Allow downgrading guest MTU settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-16 22:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/dnsmasq.conf.erb', 'recipes/dhcp_agent.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'spec/dhcp_agent_spec.rb', 'templates/default/dhcp_agent.ini.erb'], 'message': 'Allow downgrading guest MTU settings

Most standard networks will have a 1500 MTU sized
provider network.  Because there is a 24 byte overhead
with using any kind of encapsulation, most users will
want to downgrade the MTU set within their guests or
raise their internal network MTU above 1500.  The former
is much easier to do and has been added as an option to
dnsmasq that is passed to the client.

Change-Id: I199ec6e46c114d0277230eded002ad99786c061c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow downgrading guest MTU settings

Most standard networks will have a 1500 MTU sized
provider network.  Because there is a 24 byte overhead
with using any kind of encapsulation, most users will
want to downgrade the MTU set within their guests or
raise their internal network MTU above 1500.  The former
is much easier to do and has been added as an option to
dnsmasq that is passed to the client.

Change-Id: I199ec6e46c114d0277230eded002ad99786c061c

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-15 19:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'neutron/hooks.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Windows setup dependency bug

Fixes bug: #1212385

The neutron project includes a setup hook that allows to dinamically
include setup dependencies.

Due to recent changes in the pbr project, the hook raises an exception
on Windows, which ends the setup process.

This fix solves the issue by adapting the hook to the recent pbr changes.

Change-Id: I4b00d74d23a7167a10ba86458943ff16ca51b0db
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Windows setup dependency bug

Fixes bug: #1212385

The neutron project includes a setup hook that allows to dinamically
include setup dependencies.

Due to recent changes in the pbr project, the hook raises an exception
on Windows, which ends the setup process.

This fix solves the issue by adapting the hook to the recent pbr changes.

Change-Id: I4b00d74d23a7167a10ba86458943ff16ca51b0db

revisions:

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Co-authored-by: Luis A. Garcia <luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Mathew Odden <mrodden@us.ibm.com>

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Id8e92a42039d2f0b01d5c2dada733d068b2bdfeb
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for API message localization

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header.

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils, it is
possible to use the resolved language to translate an exception message
to the user requested language and return that translation from the API.

Co-authored-by: Luis A. Garcia <luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Mathew Odden <mrodden@us.ibm.com>

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: Id8e92a42039d2f0b01d5c2dada733d068b2bdfeb

subject: Add UCA repo when building Ubuntu 12.04 images
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-16 08:33:06.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/install-dependencies'], 'message': "Add UCA repo when building Ubuntu 12.04 images

Ubuntu 12.04 standard repos only contains libvirt-bin.0.9.8, but setup-network script fails if so :
 - --persistent option in virsh net-list is not present in 0.9.8
 - virtualport type='openvswitch' is not available in 0.9.8

Change-Id: I018447c1562edbf71c593785b9a17335c3687322
"}]
commit_message:
Add UCA repo when building Ubuntu 12.04 images

Ubuntu 12.04 standard repos only contains libvirt-bin.0.9.8, but setup-network script fails if so :
 - --persistent option in virsh net-list is not present in 0.9.8
 - virtualport type='openvswitch' is not available in 0.9.8

Change-Id: I018447c1562edbf71c593785b9a17335c3687322

subject: Added 3 Routers related testcases for Neutron API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1687, 'name': 'nayna-patel', 'email': 'nayna.patel@hp.com', 'username': 'nayna-patel'}, {'_account_id': 1795, 'name': 'Ravikumar Venkatesan', 'email': 'ravikumar.venkatesan@hpe.com', 'username': 'ravikumar-venkatesan'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2238, 'name': 'rajalakshmi-ganesan', 'email': 'rajalakshmi.girish@hpe.com', 'username': 'rajalakshmi-ganesan'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-08-13 12:29:16.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_routers.py'], 'message': "Added 3 Routers related testcases for Neutron API

This submission adds four test cases namely
'test_create_show_list_update_delete_router',
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'' and
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'.
The supporting methods are added to network_client.py file in
'services/json/' directory.
The script covers the actions 'Create/Delete/Update/Update/Show/Add
Interface/Remove Interface' related to Routers.

Change-Id: Ibed53376a2637105f6163519648bb8a668aaf9c7
Implements: blueprint quantum-test-l2-abstraction
"}]
commit_message:
Added 3 Routers related testcases for Neutron API

This submission adds four test cases namely
'test_create_show_list_update_delete_router',
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'' and
'test_add_remove_router_interface_with_port_id'.
The supporting methods are added to network_client.py file in
'services/json/' directory.
The script covers the actions 'Create/Delete/Update/Update/Show/Add
Interface/Remove Interface' related to Routers.

Change-Id: Ibed53376a2637105f6163519648bb8a668aaf9c7
Implements: blueprint quantum-test-l2-abstraction

subject: Catch "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" in eip.py
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-08-15 09:13:24.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_eip.py', 'heat/engine/resources/eip.py'], 'message': 'Catch "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" in eip.py

This patchset catch the "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" exception in eip
of heat, the floatingippool cannot be configured by heat currently
but it can be assigned by setting 'default_floating_pool' in

'}]
commit_message:
Catch "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" in eip.py

This patchset catch the "FloatingIpPoolNotFound" exception in eip
of heat, the floatingippool cannot be configured by heat currently
but it can be assigned by setting 'default_floating_pool' in
nova.conf

Fixes bug #1206865

Change-Id: Idd0fd39f5470904dd351a39f66a57781d9f7c444

commit_message:
Adding HOT str_replace and get_resource functions

This patch adds support for two functions, get_resource and str_replace to HOT
to enable the definition of new HOT samples. Especially str_replace aims to
simplify the definition of scripts in HOT templates.

Change-Id: Ic14fee36bdc0b9c5d79ade7ece5fa1b5331c864a

Sort distro packages

Distro packaging systems have real depenency graph generation. Keeping
the files in sorted order helps with merge conflicts.

commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

assertEqual is deprecated upstream. We've got a pending hacking check
to prevent using the wrong one (because seriously, who the heck can
remember?) But we wanted to clean out nova before landing the hacking
check.

Change-Id: Ib342314e2a74e175a0a145af32032de99d2e9767

commit_message:
Fix rabbit driver handling of None, etc. replies

Just like the bug in the fake driver, we have a similar rather
embarassing and obvious bug - we're currently not allowing endpoint
methods to send replies of None, '', False, [], {}, etc.

Change-Id: Icf0abdfcf122c5757dd3737f66130b3a53769ef6

commit_message:
Consolidate the definition of vmware config options into __init__.py

the vmware group was defined in vmops.py where there was just one
option that was registered. vnc_port_total is defined in driver.py
BUT used in vmops.py without a CONF.import_opt. Let's move all the
definitions into __init__.py to avoid issues in the future.

Change-Id: I0515e1171c93e5ac1a27e46d04ad81b518e3ebb3

commit_message:
Remove ConfFixture from toplevel public API

There's no need to make the fixtures, testtools, etc. libraries a
runtime requirement, so let's move it from the toplevel oslo.messaging
API so you need to explicitly import it.

Change-Id: I9e2f32a898d78489f2d8d9c218c81f35cda14e34

subject: Fix fake driver handling of failure replies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-16 10:09:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_rpc_server.py', 'oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py'], 'message': "Fix fake driver handling of failure replies

The driver reply() method is actually passed a full sys.exc_info()
tuple.

This was masked in the unit tests because the driver ended up basically
doing:

  raise (ValueError, ValueError, ...)

which caused a new ValueError to be instantiated and the test was
satisified. However, if an exception type has some required arguments,
you'll get a TypeError when this statement attempts to instantiate it
with no arguments.

Change-Id: I4af9c5084954d7b9c5f02cdae3387d17c206985b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fake driver handling of failure replies

The driver reply() method is actually passed a full sys.exc_info()
tuple.

This was masked in the unit tests because the driver ended up basically
doing:

  raise (ValueError, ValueError, ...)

which caused a new ValueError to be instantiated and the test was
satisified. However, if an exception type has some required arguments,
you'll get a TypeError when this statement attempts to instantiate it
with no arguments.

Change-Id: I4af9c5084954d7b9c5f02cdae3387d17c206985b

commit_message:
Fix is_cinder_installed check

The is_cinder_installed check had a bad path
specified and would always return FALSE, thereby
always skipping tests that needed it.

This patch fixes the check to work properly.

Now that tests are running again a bug has been
detected in one of the tests, that test is now marked
with a skip and and a defect has been submitted/listed.

Fixes bug: 1213226

Change-Id: I280f005b1eac4c4eb523f803de7df3e8a2d1aba9

commit_message:
Don't relabel devstack-gate nodes

We now count on the gearman plugin to take these nodes offline
when the build is complete, so there should be no need to prevent
other jobs from running on these nodes with the relabel hack.

Change-Id: I859c506451f885c9e0fd318766aa1aa454fe7b3d

The Python Keystone client handles password when asking for the authentication
of users and administrators, and gets a token when authentication succeeds.

Passwords are long-term sensitive information that should not appear in the
log files of an OpenStack production environment.

Each line of code generating log entries have been reviewed in order to

Fixes: bug #1004114

Change-Id: I67232a3a1fb96eb2ac1bf9515d281e5f7608afc8'}]
commit_message:
Make sure python-keystoneclient does not log sensitive information

The Python Keystone client handles password when asking for the authentication
of users and administrators, and gets a token when authentication succeeds.

Passwords are long-term sensitive information that should not appear in the
log files of an OpenStack production environment.

Each line of code generating log entries have been reviewed in order to
replace passwords with a specific, non-sensitive constant.

Fixes: bug #1004114

Change-Id: I67232a3a1fb96eb2ac1bf9515d281e5f7608afc8

subject: Fix 'olso' typo in lib/oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-16 18:57:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/oslo'], 'message': "Fix 'olso' typo in lib/oslo

This enables commit If92073be5a431840701c952a194e63a7c452c9ca
for cleaning up potentially installed older oslo.config. Here are
its original details.

If the user had oslo.config installed prior to us setting up the
oslo.config out of git they can get themselves into this very funny
situation where pip doesn't see oslo.config 1.1.x, however some
packages might. This manifests itself as a user error trying to
start nova-api which uses DeprecatedOption, not in oslo.config 1.1.x

Because of the funny state pip is in, you can't uninstall oslo.config.

So in these situations, if we see old oslo.config in the filesystem,
pip install / uninstall it to ensure that everyone ends up using the
git version instead.

To reduce the amount of user confusion, do this on every
install_oslo for a while, which we can purge after Havana ships.

Change-Id: I7fa0b70497bf5622f4638da284afe5363a004d3c
Fixes: bug #1213089
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'olso' typo in lib/oslo

This enables commit If92073be5a431840701c952a194e63a7c452c9ca
for cleaning up potentially installed older oslo.config. Here are
its original details.

If the user had oslo.config installed prior to us setting up the
oslo.config out of git they can get themselves into this very funny
situation where pip doesn't see oslo.config 1.1.x, however some
packages might. This manifests itself as a user error trying to
start nova-api which uses DeprecatedOption, not in oslo.config 1.1.x

Because of the funny state pip is in, you can't uninstall oslo.config.

So in these situations, if we see old oslo.config in the filesystem,
pip install / uninstall it to ensure that everyone ends up using the
git version instead.

To reduce the amount of user confusion, do this on every
install_oslo for a while, which we can purge after Havana ships.

Change-Id: I7fa0b70497bf5622f4638da284afe5363a004d3c
Fixes: bug #1213089

subject: Remove metadata route injection restriction
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1475, 'name': 'Joe Breu', 'email': 'breu@breu.org', 'username': 'breu'}, {'_account_id': 2556, 'name': 'Evan Callicoat', 'email': 'apsu@propter.net', 'username': 'diopter'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 7511, 'name': 'Joe Duhamel', 'email': 'jduhamel@mac.com', 'username': 'jduhamel'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-07 21:15:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Remove metadata route injection restriction

When using the enable_isolated_metadata flag, if gateway-ip is
set (implicitly or explicitly), dnsmasq will not inject the metadata
route, presumably under the assumption that a subnet with a gateway will
rely on the router owning the gateway IP to handle metadata
routing. However, in our deployments we have found many valid use-cases
for subnets with external routers but internal metadata via the
metadata-agent. It seems that this scenario is exactly what "isolated metadata"
should entail, but the current code checks for enable_isolated_metadata
and that gateway-ip is not set.

Without this change, an awkward workaround is required to have an
external gateway-ip and metadata route injection, by passing the default
route as a static host route, disabling the gateway-ip attribute and
adjusting the allocation-pool to account for the gateway IP, like so:

subnet-create --no-gateway --host-route \
destination=0.0.0.0/0,nexthop=x.x.x.1 --allocation-pool \
start=x.x.x.2,end=x.x.x.254 net1 x.x.x.0/24

This gateway_ip check seems to be an unnecessary restriction.

Fixes: bug #1209396
Change-Id: I72285b8d51139a181b38b301f5835a22b803368b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove metadata route injection restriction

When using the enable_isolated_metadata flag, if gateway-ip is
set (implicitly or explicitly), dnsmasq will not inject the metadata
route, presumably under the assumption that a subnet with a gateway will
rely on the router owning the gateway IP to handle metadata
routing. However, in our deployments we have found many valid use-cases
for subnets with external routers but internal metadata via the
metadata-agent. It seems that this scenario is exactly what "isolated metadata"
should entail, but the current code checks for enable_isolated_metadata
and that gateway-ip is not set.

Without this change, an awkward workaround is required to have an
external gateway-ip and metadata route injection, by passing the default
route as a static host route, disabling the gateway-ip attribute and
adjusting the allocation-pool to account for the gateway IP, like so:

subnet-create --no-gateway --host-route \
destination=0.0.0.0/0,nexthop=x.x.x.1 --allocation-pool \
start=x.x.x.2,end=x.x.x.254 net1 x.x.x.0/24

This gateway_ip check seems to be an unnecessary restriction.

Fixes: bug #1209396
Change-Id: I72285b8d51139a181b38b301f5835a22b803368b

commit_message:
Enable AvailabilityZone in AWS::EC2::Volume

Previously, the AvailabilityZone passed to the volume was ignored.

*** WARNING ***
The tests are currently failing. This patch is provided for reference only.

commit_message:
Move glance image service client from nova and cinder.

This is now present in nova and cinder, and it will be also needed in ironic,
so moving it into a common location.

Most of the code was present on nova.image.glance and cinder.image.glance.

glanceclient/exc.py => nova.exception <=> cinder.exception
 GlanceBaseException
 GlanceConnectionFailed
 ImageNotFound
 ImageNotAuthorized
 Invalid

Implements: blueprint image-tools

Change-Id: Ibb2c44df99ae5746e32695e69078737cc6b5aeeb

commit_message:
Demo for swift-ec project

NB: hacking style to verify some design only

* add example ec lib(FECpp) in common/ec.py
* allow obj-server to read/write 'ec_objects' dir
* load ecobject_ring in proxy/server.py
* filter out ec requests and let specific func to handle

With some basic codes it should be much easier to talk about the
detail design.

subject: remove run_filter_once_per_request from GroupAntiAffinityFilter
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-08-09 16:07:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/affinity_filter.py'], 'message': "remove run_filter_once_per_request from GroupAntiAffinityFilter

Now GroupAntiAffinityFilter was defined to run once per request,
but this is not right, as after one VM instance was created, the
field of 'group_hosts' in filter_properties will be updated, and
GroupAntiAffinityFilter will get all 'group_hosts' from
filter_properties to make sure VM instances will not be deployed
on hosts in same 'group_hosts'.

So if there are multiple VMs in one request, the VM deployment
will not obey GroupAntiAffinityFilter, as some VMs might be
deployed on to same host with current VMs.

Fix bug 1206502

Change-Id: I0b663df422605b05d641c64197a3c6db0ac22b74
"}]
commit_message:
remove run_filter_once_per_request from GroupAntiAffinityFilter

Now GroupAntiAffinityFilter was defined to run once per request,
but this is not right, as after one VM instance was created, the
field of 'group_hosts' in filter_properties will be updated, and
GroupAntiAffinityFilter will get all 'group_hosts' from
filter_properties to make sure VM instances will not be deployed
on hosts in same 'group_hosts'.

So if there are multiple VMs in one request, the VM deployment
will not obey GroupAntiAffinityFilter, as some VMs might be
deployed on to same host with current VMs.

Fix bug 1206502

Change-Id: I0b663df422605b05d641c64197a3c6db0ac22b74

commit_message:
Add Cors support as a wsgi middleware

This new middleware covers all common Cors usecases. It will (optionally)
respond to preflight OPTIONS requests, and it will add the configured Cross
Origin Resource Sharing headers to all responses to CORS requests. (not just
the preflight request)

Change-Id: Iac9663dd9f3f18fbe600c41778416a7789457b72
Implements: blueprint cors-support
Fixes: bug #987044

commit_message:
Echo service start failures.

* functions: Previously screen_it would log service start failures by
touching a file, this isn't very useful when working with Jenkins.
Switch to echo'ing that a service failed to start and pipe that through
tee so that we can keep the old behavior of touching a file (note this
behavior is slightly modified and the touched file will now have
contents).

Change-Id: I2d3f272b9a65a9d64dbbc01373a02fccf52f56a8

subject: Improve performance of driver's get_available_nodes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-08-09 18:29:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/operator.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/host.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/host.py'], 'message': "Improve performance of driver's get_available_nodes

get_available_nodes() is called every time an instance is updated.  That
ends up calling get_host_stats(refresh=True), resulting in a
libvirt/XenAPI/etc call.  On a build of a new instance when the instance
record is updated often (task_state and progress), this results in a lot
of unnecessary driver calls.

This changes get_available_nodes() to take a refresh kwarg to pass
through to get_host_stats(), defaulting to False so that it uses
the cache.  Places that used get_available_nodes() and are sensitive to
stale data are changed to add refresh=True.  Also adds a helper driver
method for 'is_node_available'.  And make sure that even if drivers'
get_host_stats() methods get refresh=False that they refresh when they
have no stats.

Fixes bug 1210264

Change-Id: I22c8d70e3e70f2d2421915da66c2618688e0db2b
"}]
commit_message:
Improve performance of driver's get_available_nodes

get_available_nodes() is called every time an instance is updated.  That
ends up calling get_host_stats(refresh=True), resulting in a
libvirt/XenAPI/etc call.  On a build of a new instance when the instance
record is updated often (task_state and progress), this results in a lot
of unnecessary driver calls.

This changes get_available_nodes() to take a refresh kwarg to pass
through to get_host_stats(), defaulting to False so that it uses
the cache.  Places that used get_available_nodes() and are sensitive to
stale data are changed to add refresh=True.  Also adds a helper driver
method for 'is_node_available'.  And make sure that even if drivers'
get_host_stats() methods get refresh=False that they refresh when they
have no stats.

Fixes bug 1210264

Change-Id: I22c8d70e3e70f2d2421915da66c2618688e0db2b

subject: Unify DatabaseBroker.reclaim
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2828, 'name': 'Michael Barton', 'email': 'mike@weirdlooking.com', 'username': 'redbo'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-16 23:08:10.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db.py'], 'message': 'Unify DatabaseBroker.reclaim

Both AccountBroker and ContainerBroker install their own reclaim()
methods, which are the same, modulo the table and column names.
Also, the parent reclaim() method is unused, except as a tramptoline
to test _reclaim().

This patch gets rid of the unused code by moving it into the tests,
and unifies the reclaim() method in DatabaseBroker. We use the
same class parameters that are already in use elsewhere.

The unused code was found when documenting the DB broker API for
the LFS. The unification fell out of reviews by Clay and Peter.

Change-Id: Ic5e38a9e39dafe8e0bc062818151edece384f3b5
'}]
commit_message:
Unify DatabaseBroker.reclaim

Both AccountBroker and ContainerBroker install their own reclaim()
methods, which are the same, modulo the table and column names.
Also, the parent reclaim() method is unused, except as a tramptoline
to test _reclaim().

This patch gets rid of the unused code by moving it into the tests,
and unifies the reclaim() method in DatabaseBroker. We use the
same class parameters that are already in use elsewhere.

The unused code was found when documenting the DB broker API for
the LFS. The unification fell out of reviews by Clay and Peter.

Change-Id: Ic5e38a9e39dafe8e0bc062818151edece384f3b5

commit_message:
Convert admin_actions ext tests to unit tests

The tests for the admin_actions API extension (or v3 plugin) are
stubbing out conductor methods, which creates a lot of pain when
compute_api internals are changed.  Convert these tests to unit tests,
checking only that the appropriate compute_api methods are called with
the correct arguments.

Change-Id: I16634efa2397b36afa15b90712bfd678325bc049

commit_message:
Unit-ify the compute API resize tests

Move resize related compute API tests to test_compute_api and make them
unit tests.  This makes test changes easier when converting to objects.

This also caught a couple things where the cells compute api class was
not in sync that don't really end up being bugs, but need to match for
tests to pass.

Change-Id: I194310beb5e821e4a8262310d1bb80e0747e1c43

commit_message:
Enforce compute:update policy in API

Now that compute/api.py:update() is no longer being called for instance
updates the policy check is no longer enforced.  This adds policy
checking back in at the API level so that the compute:update policy will
continue to function as it did before.

Bug 1212807

Change-Id: I365ad8ac2845d914deefb841c314a50f4869dba0

It seems as this conversion was missed, as a git blame says the first

2010-07-12 Initial commit of Swift code".

While we were in here, we moved _parse_path() to a module method as
there appears to be need to keep it as an object controller method.

We also fixed up as many of the tests that directly invoked the object
controller methods to use get_response(), addressing a few

Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Some how DELETE not using _parse_path()

It seems as this conversion was missed, as a git blame says the first
few lines of DELETE date all the way back to commit 001407b9 "(creiht)
2010-07-12 Initial commit of Swift code".

While we were in here, we moved _parse_path() to a module method as
there appears to be need to keep it as an object controller method.

We also fixed up as many of the tests that directly invoked the object
controller methods to use get_response(), addressing a few
inconsistencies along the way.

Change-Id: If491c7129d61d6fc7d81401fbc3650c29ed80465
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

subject: Fixes SSH injection threat in 3PAR driver
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-16 15:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': "Fixes SSH injection threat in 3PAR driver

The setqos ssh command was not built up correctly when the following
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37697/ landed for cleaning up
the SSH calls from injection attacks in the 3PAR driver.

The command was in the following format causing the injection threat
due to the spaces in the second item in the list:
['setqos', '-io 5000 -bw 500M vvset:vvs-JOHB2Oj0QJ2UaWatwbe7Bg']
When it should actually be in the following format:
['setqos', '-io', '5000', '-bw', '500M', 'vvset:vvs-JOHB2Oj0QJ2UaWatwbe7Bg']

This patch fixes an append vs. extend that was introduced in patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42241

Also fixes: bug 1212884

Change-Id: I28f84acd02397ee0d433a666375737145904d67e
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes SSH injection threat in 3PAR driver

The setqos ssh command was not built up correctly when the following
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37697/ landed for cleaning up
the SSH calls from injection attacks in the 3PAR driver.

The command was in the following format causing the injection threat
due to the spaces in the second item in the list:
['setqos', '-io 5000 -bw 500M vvset:vvs-JOHB2Oj0QJ2UaWatwbe7Bg']
When it should actually be in the following format:
['setqos', '-io', '5000', '-bw', '500M', 'vvset:vvs-JOHB2Oj0QJ2UaWatwbe7Bg']

This patch fixes an append vs. extend that was introduced in patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42241

Also fixes: bug 1212884

Change-Id: I28f84acd02397ee0d433a666375737145904d67e

commit_message:
Implements configurable swift_owner_headers

These are headers that will be stripped unless the WSGI environment
contains a true value for 'swift_owner'. The exact definition of a
swift_owner is up to the auth system in use, but usually indicates
administrative responsibilities.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I972772fbbd235414e00130ca663428e8750cabca

commit_message:
Fix LDAP Identity get user with user_enabled_mask

Fetching users using the LDAP Identity backend would fail with

 KeyError: 'enabled'

from _ldap_res_to_model when user_enabled_mask is not 0.

Closes-Bug: #1210175

commit_message:
Fix LDAP Identity with non-zero user_enabled_default

The LDAP Identity backend was not properly using the
user_enabled_default option as a string. This caused
operations to fail with

 TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for &: 'str' and 'int'

Partial-Bug: #1210175

Change-Id: I54931e669186871d18dea088870945b9de40d573

commit_message:
Implement missing Coraid Driver functionality for Havana

Intorduce a brick connector for AoE protocol.
Refactoring Coraid Driver. Implement missing functionality for Havana:
- Copy Volume To Image
- Copy Image To Volume
- Clone Volume

Fix a bug with resize volume command.

Change-Id: I2af6a41dc44cb8bc4b74da752e0be9ed54a83cb1
Implements: blueprint coraid-driver-refactoring-for-havana

commit_message:
WIP: Add necessary v3 parts to boot a VM

Still very WIP, but this time using Glance for image operations
instead of the outgoing os-images extension.  Again, these
changes were sufficient to boot a VM, but a lot more testing and
cleanup work is needed.

Note: This will fail Jenkins because some of the requests to Nova
had to change.  I'm not going to update the test cases until I'm
more certain this is the right approach.

bp v3-api

Change-Id: I252a9c4ecc6696fa50b009b7195844a41c51da11

subject: Change whitespace check to be info only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-13 08:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/validate.py'], 'message': 'Change whitespace check to be info only

The recent introduction of the whitespace check has been good for
improving our consistency, however while discussion is ongoing
about how to best manage whitespace, the check should be non-voting.

This patch (intended to be temporary while discussion continues)
changes the script to print when whitespace is wrong,
rather than leaving a -1 vote.

Change-Id: I082aa4418864cd50d087dfe01c3bfff4d6df9f8f
'}]
commit_message:
Change whitespace check to be info only

The recent introduction of the whitespace check has been good for
improving our consistency, however while discussion is ongoing
about how to best manage whitespace, the check should be non-voting.

This patch (intended to be temporary while discussion continues)
changes the script to print when whitespace is wrong,
rather than leaving a -1 vote.

Change-Id: I082aa4418864cd50d087dfe01c3bfff4d6df9f8f

This adds support to the glance client library for removing
properties from an image. Properties to be removed must be
explicitly listed. There is no equivalent of the 'purge_props'
functionality in v1.

Also beefed up testing around create since some of the

commit_message:
\Allow removal of properties using glance v2 api

This adds support to the glance client library for removing
properties from an image. Properties to be removed must be
explicitly listed. There is no equivalent of the 'purge_props'
functionality in v1.

Also beefed up testing around create since some of the
functionality is the same as update.

Fixes bug 1206472

Change-Id: I16f4c39cdfc8a0cd07bede600461b7a289fbb080

subject: Staticweb shortcut object 404s
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-31 21:24:36.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/staticweb.py'], 'message': 'Staticweb shortcut object 404s

Right now static web checks to see if it should handle a
request and if it decides that it shouldn't, in all cases,
it lets the request pass through the pipeline normally.
After this change on "x-web-mode: t" obj requests where
staticweb is not setup and an object 404s it will just
return the 404 instead of letting the app send a duplicate
request to the object servers.

Change-Id: I824f4b03f7546d26084fd51b97ea6e290169d22a
'}]
commit_message:
Staticweb shortcut object 404s

Right now static web checks to see if it should handle a
request and if it decides that it shouldn't, in all cases,
it lets the request pass through the pipeline normally.
After this change on "x-web-mode: t" obj requests where
staticweb is not setup and an object 404s it will just
return the 404 instead of letting the app send a duplicate
request to the object servers.

Change-Id: I824f4b03f7546d26084fd51b97ea6e290169d22a
